Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Manuel de 27 años de edad tiene 3 hijos estudiantes en su comunidad y son excelentes estudiantes, el a querido abrir puertas para el futuro para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condicione de vidas adecuadas en el futuro.

La actividad que el desempeña con todo empeño es la venta de abarrotería en su comunidad dicho negocio a el le a funcionado porque no tiene mucha competencia por el lugar y eso le genera ganancias para poder sustentar a su familia que tanto lo necesitan, para tener una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de un terreno que se le está ofreciendo. Uno de los sueños de Manuel es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en el campo de la educación y llegar a niveles importantes en empresas de prestigios.
texts.en:
Manuel got the chance to work as in a convenience store. As he anticipated, it not only opened a door, but revealed what was behind that door. And what he found was something that defined who he wanted to be. Manuel is 27 years old with 3 children, who are excellent students in the community school. Manuel strives to create opportunities for his children so that they will have good lives in the future. 

The work that he does with all of his determination is selling groceries in his community. This business is doing well, as there is not much competition in the area. With this business, he can generate income to support his family, so that they can have a better quality of life in the near future. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase land that is for sale. One of Manuel's dreams is to see his children grow up and complete higher education, and to hold significant positions in prestigious companies.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Loern's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Damabe district, Loern is 29 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. She is a farmer who has been growing rice and cassava for five years. She currently can earn about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is a microloan for Loern’s group; she is a second-cycle client. The first loan has helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: 2040405 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà has a service business tailoring clothes. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hà is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hải is the group leader of the 2040405 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth to sew clothes to sell.

In the future, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sew clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nacazcol (black dye), different types of clay and firewood in order to make various types of earthenware.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn Trầu Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Tuyên is in agriculture, farming rice. Tuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Tuyên is 44 years old, and she is married with two children. In 2009, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyên has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 07 Thôn Trầu xã Công Liêm solidarity group

Tuyên is applying for a loan to purchase more tools for farming rice.

In the future, Tuyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for farming rice

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Ry is 40 years old and married. She manages to earn her living via cassava farming and a paid-working job as the main sources of income. She has involved in current business for 15 years, earning about 40,200 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Ry with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, that she has fully repaid back, has upgraded her lifestyle gradually. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For Ry, her entire loan portion will be used to buy insecticide for her cash crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for her cash crop

loans.name: Gladis Jeanethe

texts.es:
La señora Gladis de 39  años de edad, no  tiene  hijos que dependen  de ella, vive con su hermana en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Gladis también vende ropa usada y nueva,  sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que pasan a diario por su negocio es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora que desea superarse.
Doña Gladis está solicitando el préstamo para compra ropa interior como bóxer, braceares, chores, pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc. para su segundo negocio, con el apoyo del préstamo espera que su negocio sea más fuerte y que sus ganancias sean la necesarias para sacar adelante a su familia es por tal razón que solicita su tercer crédito está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Gladis is 39 years old with no dependent children. She lives with her sister in her own home, which is in the town of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. She has sold groceries for a living for the past 3 years. 

Gladis also sells new and used clothes. Her customers are her friends, neighbors and the daily passers-by.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who constantly strives to improve herself.

Gladis is requesting a loan to buy underwear and intimates, such as boxers, bras, shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. With the support of this loan, she hopes that her second business becomes stronger and that she achieves the earnings to enable her family to get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting her third loan, and is very happy to continue working with Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014.

loans.use: to buy underwear and intimates, such as boxers, bras, shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. for her store.

loans.name: 204080003Thành Xuân - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà is 35 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hà's family are fisherman. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2007, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 204080003Thành Xuân - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing net to catch fish.

In the future, Hà hopes to remodel her house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing net to catch fish

loans.name: Daisy Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Daisy de 40  años de edad es casada vive con sus dos hijos quienes están en el kinder y colegio, vive un barrio de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Daisy se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de abarrotaría, su negocio está ubicado en el interior de un mercado de su comunidad, por donde transitan muchas personas a diario las cuales le compran su producto y en estos momentos necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café,  manteca, aceites, papel higiénico, jabones, etc. para su negocio. Con las ganancias pretende ir creciendo más su negocio y suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia e hijos.
Su sueño es tener una bodega grande donde pueda vender de todo y atender mejor a sus clientes y por lo consiguiente tener mejores ingresos, es un excelente clienta que solicita su octavo préstamo con Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Daisy is 40 years old, married and lives with her two children who are in kindergarten and school. She lives in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Daisy has worked for the last 5 years at her grocery store which is located inside the local community market. A lot of people go there every day who buy her products. At this time she needs a loan to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, margarine, oil, toilet paper, soap, etc. for her business. With the profits she hopes expand her business and supply the basic needs of her family and children. Her dream is to have a big store where she can sell everything and serve her clients better and therefor having more income. She is an excellent client who is requesting her eight loan from Prisma.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, margarine, oil, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: 12-03-04 Phố Môi - Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Vân operates a small restaurant selling rice noodles. She is applying for a loan to purchase more noodles to cook and sell.

Vân is 45 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 12-03-04 Phố Môi - Quảng Tâm solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

In the future, Vân hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more noodles to cook and sell

loans.name: 01 Nam Vượng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lệ is 31 years old, and she is married with four children. She has a service business tailoring clothes. Lệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2013, Lệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 01 Nam Vượng solidarity group. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth to sew clothes to sell.

In the future, Lệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sew clothes to sell

loans.name: 0204021000003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy is 36 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Thủy's family are in the fishing business. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 0204021000003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing net to catch fish.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing net to catch fish

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn Trung1 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Loan operates a food stall selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fish to resell. 

Loan is 23 years old, and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 08 Thôn Trung1 - Quảng Nham solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don Manuel Antonio, con muchos años de experiencia en su labor cotidiana en el sector estatal, él con sacrificio ha venido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y aprovechando al máximo los créditos, anteriormente logró levantar una tapia en la vivienda de sus tres hijos mayores los que no habitan con él pero les apoya de alguna manera.  Esta vez solicita nuevamente crédito para construir una Tapia en el patio de la vivienda actual para contar con mayor seguridad y protección.  su esposa es ama de casa y queda al cuido de su menor hijo el que estudia la primaria por quien don Manuel lucha a diario, su propósito es ver a sus hijos preparados principalmente el menor que es el que aun depende de él.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio  has many years of experience in his daily work in the state sector. With sacrifice he has been gradually improving his home, and by making maximum use of loans, he has previously managed to put up a wall on the patio of his three adult children who don't live with him but whom he supports to some extent. 

This time he is again requesting a loan in our order to build a wall on on the patio of his current home in order to have greater security and protection. His wife looks after the home and their youngest child, who is going to primary school and for whom Manuel strives daily. His aim is to see his children educated, especially the youngest, who is the one who still depends on him.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building an enclosure wall.

loans.name: Morkhon

texts.ru: Морхон пожилая швея из города Душанбе, проживающая там вместе с сыном и внуком. Ей 63 года и она все еще занимается своим любимым делом шитьем. Свой швейный бизнес Морхон открыла 10 лет назад. Она предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома и принимает заказ на пошив женских платьев национальных фасонов. Несмотря на свой пожилой возраст она все еще активная и старается расширить деятельность. Вот сейчас Морхон берет кредит для того, чтобы купить ткани и другие необходимые принадлежности для шитья. В будущем она хочет открыть свое частное ателье.
texts.en: Morkhon is a retired seamstress from Dushanbe, where she lives with her son and grandson.  She is 63 years old and she still does what she loves most - sewing.  She opened her sewing business 10 years ago.  Morkhon offers her sewing services out of her home, taking commissions to sew women's national costumes.  Despite her age, she is still active and she is trying to expand her business.  Now Morkhon is asking for a loan to buy fabric and other necessary sewing supplies.  In the future, she wants to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and necessary sewing supplies.

loans.name: 170001.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Mrs. Tình is 37 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 170001.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2010, Mrs. Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs. Tình hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 090003.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thêm operates a food stall selling soft drinks, sweets, and cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, sweets, and cake to resell.

Mrs. Thêm is 25 years old, and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 090003.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province, with one dependent.

This is Mrs. Thêm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profits, Mrs. Thêm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, sweets, and cake to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 6 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Nhị lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is 41 years old and she is married with three children. Nhị's family are fishermen. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing netting to catch fish.

Nhị is the group leader of the Nhóm 6 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group, which consists of three members.

In 2012, Nhị joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nhị faces in her business is natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Nhị hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing netting to catch fish

loans.name: Iris Janeth

texts.es: Iris, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde hace 3 años, y lo tiene ubicado en una escuela donde  ofrece los productos como ser, pastelitos relleno con carne, baleadas, refrescos y tajadas con carne. Ha solicitado un  préstamo por 10,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá, en la compra de materia prima  como carnes, harina, frijoles, condimentos, tajadas etc. para poder elaborar las comidas y vender. Su idea es tener surtido de insumos,  aumentar las ventas  y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Iris is 46 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Olanchito, Yoro. She has been selling food for three years, and her location is in a school where she offers products such as pastries stuffed with meat, baleadas [flour tortillas filled with beans, cheese and other ingredients], soft drinks, and fried plantain slices with meat. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of basic materials such as meats, flour, beans, condiments, plantains, etc., to be able to make her food and sell it. Her idea is to be stocked with supplies, increase her sales, and give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as meats, flour, beans, condiments, plantains, etc., to be able to prepare food and sell it.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Kong is 29 years old and married. She has four dependent children. She is a rice farmer, and she also grows cassava to help support the family. She has been in this business for 13 years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day and is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Kong has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles, and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it on labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully, and she also hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en:
Yeam, 49, is from a rural village located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with four children, only one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through growing rice, supplementing their income by raising pigs and ducks. They have been in this business for several years. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day.

Yeam has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to pay for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saray's Group

texts.en:
Saray is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four sons in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She is a farmer who has grown rice and cassava for 23 years, and she also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 68,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 34,000 KHR each day.

This is the fourth loan for Saray with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio se destaca por ser una persona trabajadora, diario labora de conductor de Taxi para garantizar el pan de cada día a su familia que esta conformada por su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, ademas de su trabajo como conductor también se dedica al comercio de Cosméticos, ropa, y mercadería en general aunque en pequeñas cantidades en unidad con su esposa, y así pasan la vida y han salido adelante.  Necesita este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar camisetas, pantalones de adulto, ropa de niños, entre otros que están demandando sus clientes ya que se aproximan las Fiestas Agustinas en la Localidad de Juigalpa y es donde hay mayor demanda de sus productos y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar.  Para don Manuel Antonio este crédito es una necesidad y desde ya agradece a Afodenic y Kiva por la oportunidad del financiamiento que le sera muy útil y provechoso.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is known for being a hardworking person. Every day he drives his taxi so that he can be sure of food to put on the table for his family. His family consists of his wife and two young children. As well as being a driver he sells cosmetics, clothing, and general merchandise in small quantities. His wife helps him. This is how they spend their days and how they are making progress.

Now Manuel needs a loan to buy shirts and pants for adults, and children’s clothing etc for his business. These are the items that his customers are looking for. The August holidays are approaching in the Juigalpa area--that is when there is the greatest demand for this merchandise, and Manuel doesn’t have enough money to buy these much needed items.

He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the chance to get a loan which will be most useful and beneficial.

loans.use: buy clothing for his business

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn is a 44-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Sithor Kandal district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been weaving mats while her husband helps to earn more income by working as a house construction worker and a garment worker in the local area. The current business earns her about 42,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Chanthorn’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chanthorn will use her portion to buy materials for supporting her weaving business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her weaving business

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for raising bananas and tools for working the land.

loans.name: Nhóm 09- Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future. Lan has been involved in this business for 5 years and the main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lan is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Lan is the group leader of the  Nhóm 09- Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With the profit from her business, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin is a mother of two children. She is 33 years old and a resident of Battambang province. She earns income for her family via rice cropping and her paid-working job. This main source of income earns her about 41,000 KHR per day. 

Narin, the former borrower who has fully repaid her past loan, teams up in a group of two to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Narin will spend this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Narin hopes that she can make her family better now.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her through her previous loan, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. She was also able to buy additional raw supplies and products that are needed for her peanut butter business. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine hopes for her business to continue to flourish, for she dreams of giving her children a good quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Саломат является профессиональной портнихой, предоставляющей свои услуги более 10 лет. За эти годы она зарекомендовала себя как опытная портниха и у нее всегда много клиенток. Ей нравится сам процесс шитья, а также то, что ее деятельность каждый день приносит ей доход.
Саломат уже исполнилось 55 лет. У нее пятеро детей. А муж работает за границей. В деятельности Саломат помогают ее оба дочерей. Сейчас Саломат думает расширить свой швейный бизнес. Она просит кредит для купли модернизированной швейной машинки. Таким образом Саломат хочет ускорить и улучшить качество предоставляемой услуги. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: Salomat is a professional seamstress, who has been providing her services for over 10 years. Over these years, she has established herself as an experienced seamstress and always has many clients. She likes the process of sewing and also the fact that her business earns her an income every day. Salomat has already turned 55 years old. She has five children. Her husband works abroad. Both of Salomat's daughters help her with the business. Now Salomat wants to expand her sewing business. She is requesting this loan to purchase a modern sewing machine. This is how Salomat wants to speed up and improve the quality of provided services. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn 6 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng works in agriculture raising poultry. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hằng is 47 years old, and she is married with three children. Hằng lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hằng is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 thôn 6 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Hằng’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in radio and print ads and participate in trade shows.

loans.name: Filipa

texts.en: Retailing has helped Filipa survive for her family. She retails stock and brings in a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling goods easy and simple because all she needed to do is weigh and repack sugar and other additives for her buyers. Filipa plans to expand her retailing business. She has applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital  to purchase inventories of stock for retail. Filipa smiles at the fact that she can see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of stock for retail.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is from Ozamz City. She is 62, married, and has three school-age kids. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC, and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. Because of her desire to help her family, she is engaged in selling a variety of merchandise and household items.  This has been her source of income for the past 15 years. She uses only her motorcycle as her source of transportation to reach the different barangays. 

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase more inventory, such as plastic housewares, to sell. Through this, she hopes to increase her income to be able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is also happy that she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic housewares

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
When Raymond suffered a serious injury, he realized that the traditional first aid kit is lacking technology that allows people to easily and efficiently analyze an injury, alert the appropriate facilities, and handle the injury to the best of their abilities until the paramedics arrive. A molecular biologist from Ghana, Raymond decided to use his expertise to create a solution. Raymond established CuraKit, and is launching his first product, the “Mobile External Diagnostic Integrated Kit” (MeDiK).

MeDiK is a mobile electronic device that can be used as a first aid response. It essentially combines several first-responder resources into one device. The compact device will be used to record and provide information at the scene of an emergency. It will be able to take blood samples, provide oxygen, locate nearby emergency personnel, and will contain medical supplies such as gauze. 

“I wish to use my quantitative strengths to design products that meet the needs of the sporting industry and families.” 

However, in order to complete his vision, Raymond needs to source parts and test his product. Help Raymond improve his product so that he is able to help save lives.

loans.use: to source parts and test his product.

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
Dorcy runs a tailoring business. She made good use of a previous loan to buy the materials she needs to do her work. She has been in this line of work for 15 years, and she shares her responsibilities with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies such as fabric, cloth, and thread. The profits she earns from this loan will help her meet her daily needs. She is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

Dorcy hopes to expand soon, for she desires to help others by means of employing them in her own tailoring shop. She meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and single.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing 21000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been fattening pigs for 3 years and she earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
As one of the oldest groups who received loans and training from MUK, Tunjung Wiguna’s main goal is to make all the members successful with maintaining the pigs and to have enough savings to use as capital. After several loan cycles, two of the member resigned from the group and stopped borrowing loans. Now they have enough savings and can continue their business with their own money. They feel grateful for the loans and the training they had. It made them more knowledgeable and also able to earn incomes to support their families.

The other seven members of Tunjung Wiguna Group continue to have a new loan. The total loan is 10,500,000 IDR, with each receiving 1,500,000 IDR.  Ni Ketut will use her loan not only for pigs, but now also for farming. She will use her loan to purchase two local species of piglets and also paddy seeds. She has a rice field near her house. She hopes both businesses will bring her a satisfactory result. All the members of the group are doing the same. They start to use the loan for breeding and farming to increase their incomes. They hope all the plans run smoothly, and that they can be a successful breeders and farmers.

loans.use: to purchase two local species of piglets and also paddy seeds.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Born in the Bahamas, Robert came to the United States seeking opportunity and education. After attending college, his passion for computers led Robert into the computer consulting industry. Working for many years, he was constantly asked if he knew others with similar skills. Realizing that his valuable business experience set him up with a network of qualified computer technicians, Robert decided to go into business for himself. 

Robert turned his dream into a reality when he started Tech Nerds (Technerdsplus.com). Still working 40 hours a week as a computer consultant, Robert gives an additional 80 hours of his week to Tech Nerds. Robert has the freedom to explore new ideas and become more financially stable. 

Robert is proud to have landed a large government contract for his business. However, Robert needs capital to be able to fulfill this contract. Robert will use his loan to expand and meet payroll obligations. The additional capital will allow Robert to hire more computer technicians and land bigger and better contracts.

loans.use: to cover additional payroll to hire more employees.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Ozamiz, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Lina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Lina wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia owns and operates a food stall. She has been successful in this business for twelve years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her small meat vending business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profits. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Alicia hopes to make improvement of her business. She dreams for her children to become successful and to have prosperous lives. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Helenia

texts.en:
Helenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal business in the Philippines.

Helenia requested a 23000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Helenia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has always been good with his hands. He started off tinkering with his friends’ cell phones and finally, encouraged by his friends and family, he opened up a cell phone repair store. 

With three employees, Emmanuel turned his hobby into a passion, and his passion into a business. He will use the loan to expand his business into more locations, as well as build a website. 

He hopes to one day open a few more storefronts and establish himself online to attract a larger customer base.

loans.use: to expand his business into more locations, as well as invest in building a website.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa has faithfully paid back her previous loan that she used for her business. She has been engaged in buying and selling herbal medicines and food supplements for more than nine years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Marissa is requesting a new loan of PHP 19,000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Marissa hopes that she and her family will be financially secure. She dreams to have her own car and house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional supply of herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for nine years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Francisca would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 35,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Francisca hopes for her business to grow more and continue to help provide for their everyday needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en: Elen has been running a retail business in order to provide for the needs of her children. She sells assorted groceries in their village to make a living.  Her husband helps her in operating her business, and at the same time is earning from their transportation services. To improve sales, she took another loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Elen wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
This is Sally. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her child. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sally hopes to expand her business and significantly increase her profit from it. She dreams to improve their general living conditions and to meet more of the needs of her family. She meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ellen Joy

texts.en: Ellen Joy is studying secondary education at the university. She is single and lives with her family. Her parents are earning from selling fish in the market. She was determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own.  She is thankful to GDMPC, which gives every student a chance to continue studying with their services specialized for students. She took a new loan recently, to pay for the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current year.  She hopes to be a successful caregiver to work abroad and to be able to have a nice source of income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is age 48, married to an overseas Filipino worker (OFW), and blessed with five children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 150 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase powdered juice, coffee, creamer, beverages, canned goods, and toothpaste to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase powdered juice, coffee, creamer, beverages, canned goods, and toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods for her grocery and food to sell breakfast

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace has been operating her own dental clinic for 21 years, and she profits well. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She and her husband work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education.

In order to improve her service, Mary Grace is requesting a new loan for 48,000 PHP to purchase additional supplies, materials, and medicines needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Mary Grace hopes to become more successful in her business, and she wants to have other sources of income. She also desires to make an investment in a house and lot. She hopes that her children will pursue their desired careers in the future. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Tuesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies, materials, and medicines

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 46 years old and married with four children.  She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Patricia has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business. She has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Patricia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Rosabell

texts.en:
Rosabell is 32 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Rosabell is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosabell has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosabell would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is single and has a broom making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business. Mamie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Mamie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her broom making business.

loans.name: Yoxaja Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
De 27 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, (ella tiene una blusa de color cafe y se encuentra en la segunda fila de la derecha a izquierda)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de dos años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Francisca para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o corte típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisca is 27 years old. She has great aspirations to publicize her community and the activity she does with such effort and dedication to everyone who visits. 

She is married and lives with her husband, with the desire to overcome in life and achieve great dreams that she wants to accomplish in life. She has two children who are students in her community's school. (She has a coffee-colored blouse and is found second in the row from the right).

The work she does with such dedication is the purchase and selling of traditional cuts of clothing. She does this activity in her house and in places close to her community where she lives. 

The second activity she does is the selling of spare parts, a business she's done with a sister for more than two years, as it gives them income for the well-being of their family and improves the economic conditions of her family and community.

She has been an example in her community, and because of this, a group of women have united with Francisca to be able to take on their businesses, so that each one of them can overcome and have important income.

The use she will give the loan she is receiving is for the purchase of merchandise or traditional cuts for their respective sale around. One of her aspirations is to have a location in her community's market.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, consisting of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he makes liquid soap to sell. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more raw materials for making liquid soap. His business goal is to own a mini factory within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making liquid soap to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is age 38, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, beverages, soy sauce, and vinegar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, beverages, soy sauce, and vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a married man who has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, a married mother of two, describes herself as determined. She has been operating a beauty salon, located in a vibrant area, for five years. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. 

Fatuma will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more beauty salon products for use in the salon. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, her previous loans having been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animal fodder

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Annabel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, bath soap, canned goods, etc. 

Annabel has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, bath soap, canned goods, etc.  In the future, Annabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, bath soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia, a 59-year-old married mother of three, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 13 years now. Having borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she is requesting a new loan of PHP 27000 to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Cicilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kaneblapa Group

texts.es: Doña Marla es una mujer con 38 años de edad, soltera y madre de 5 hijos. Trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Es la presidenta del banco mujer desde que se formó, debido a que su trabajo como líder en el grupo ha sido muy bueno, y tanto ella como las demás socias del grupo han sido muy responsable y puntuales. Este es el tercer crédito que solicitan. La actividad de Doña Marla sigue siendo la porcicultura y actualmente ella ha aumentado su producción, generando más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia y el estudio de sus hijos, ya que es una madre soltera. El financiamiento que les ha brindado la Fundación ha sido de mucha ayuda, ya que cuenta que ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. La inversión será en cerdos, alimentos y concentrados, además de hacer algunos arreglos al espacio físico en donde mantiene a los puercos. Junto con Marla hay tres socias más que invertiran el préstamo en actividades pecuarias como cerdos y pollos. Todas buscan un mismo objetivo crecer y superarse, para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
Marla is 38 years old, single, and a mother of five children. She works hard and has the desire to get ahead. She has been the president of Banco Mujer since its formation because her work as the group's leader has been outstanding. She and the other group members have been very responsible and punctual. This is the third loan they have requested.

Marla is still making a living raising pigs. Now, her production has increased, which has generated more income to cover her family's expenses and her children's education costs. 

The financing they have received from the Fundación has been very helpful. She says that it has improved her and her family's living conditions. She will invest in pigs, animal feed and concentrates. In addition, she will make some repairs to the place where she keeps the pigs. 

Together with Marla, there are three more members who will invest the loan in animal husbandry activities (pigs and chickens). They all strive for the same goal: growing their businesses and getting ahead to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, animal feed, and other items.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
Una excelente imagen de una mujer empieza desde la más pequeña hebra de cabello hasta llegar al cuidado de las uña de los pies, es aquí donde Doña María de 64 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos pero ya independientes de ella comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos hace más de tres años para que la mujer nicaragüense se vea hermosa y elegante. 
Doña María requiere de un préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como pinturas de uña, perfumes, pinturas labiales, lápiz para las cejas entre otros productos. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas y así obtener más ganancias. Sus principales expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio e ir trabajando con MiCrédito de la mano para lograrlo.
texts.en:
An excellent image of a woman begins with the smallest hair to caring for the toe nails. This is where María who is 64 years old and mother of five children now independent started her business selling cosmetics more than 3 years ago. She does it as the Nicaraguan woman must look beautiful and elegant.

María needs a loan to buy more cosmetics like nail polish, perfume, lipstick, eye liner amongst other products. She believes that this loan will be useful for her and she will be able to increase her sales and therefore make more profit. Her main hope is to expand her business and to continue to work with con MiCrédito closely to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics like nail polish, perfume, lipstick, eye liner amongst other products.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
An entrepreneur at heart, Adriana saw the opportunity to buy stainless steel jewelry at a low cost. She took this opportunity, as well as her love for negotiating, and opened up her own business. 

With low manufacturing costs, she is able to provide her customers with her jewelry at a wholesale price. Adriana and her husband need a loan to re-stock for future orders. She would also like to invest in advertising opportunities to extend past her current word-of-mouth system, as well as set up a website that allows customers to place purchase orders over the Internet.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory and invest in advertising.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow the company and invest in machinery and materials.

loans.name: Abelio Audelio

texts.es:
Abelio, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar repuestos para la moto taxi, como llantas, bujías, pastillas para frenos y mejoras en el asiento, el resto lo utilizara para cancelar artículos para el hogar, así se mantendrá trabajando y manteniendo su fuente de ingresos activa, de esta manera espera en un futuro comprar su propia unidad de transporte para mejorar sus ganancias.
Para Abelio su vida ha cambiado favorablemente, ha brindado un buen servicio a sus clientes, sus ingresos no han variado mucho pero logra cubrir todos sus compromisos, cancelo parte del costo de los artículos que ha adquirido para su hogar y su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Abelio sees the need to request a new loan to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi like tires, spark plugs, brake pads and to repair the seat. The rest he will use to pay off some items for his house. He continues to work and keep his source of income active. In this way he hopes to buy his own transportation vehicle in the future to increase his income. Life has changed favorably for Abelio. He provides good service for his clients and his income does not vary much. He manages to cover all his obligations and has paid back part of the cost of items he bought for the house. His family has a better lifestyle

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi and to pay off some household items.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar es un hombre preocupado por la salud de la población , trabaja en un centro de salud desempeñándose en el area de epidemiologia con 10 años de laborar, casado, con 2 hijos a los que les brinda todo el apoyo como buen padre, actualmente está presentando un problema familiar por tal razón visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el que invertirá en gastos personales los que les vendrán a mejorar su vida
texts.en: Cesar is a man who is focused on the local population's health. He works in a health care center in the area of epidemiology. He has worked for 10 years, is married, and has 2 children, for whom he provides all the help that a good father gives. Right now he is presented with a family problem, and for this reason he visited the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan. He will invest the loan in personal expenses that will improve his life.

loans.use: with personal family expenses.

loans.name: Estela Yamileth

texts.es:
Estela está soltera, debido a los escasos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo cursar hasta  noveno grado y luego se dedicó a ayudar a su madre quien se dedica al comercio.

Estela trabaja en compañía de su madre vendiendo pescado extraído de una laguna cercana a su casa, el pescado lo venden a la orilla de calle ya que ahí transita bastante gente, cuando termina la venta de pescados, comienza a vender  refrescos, panes y tostadas, esto lo hace todos los días para ayudar a su familia ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Ella necesita mucho el crédito para comprar más mercadería para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Sus planes son ayudar a sus padres en los gastos familiares y en un futuro lograr construir una pequeña vivienda.
texts.en: Estela is single and due to the lack of financial resources of her parents she only studied up to Grade 9. Then she started to help her mother who works in business. Estela works along with her mother selling fish taken from a lagoon close to their house. They sell the fish on the side of the street as a lot of people pass there. When the fish is sold she sells soft drinks, breads and fried plantains. She does this every day in order to help her family as this is her only source of income. She badly needs the loan to buy more merchandise to cover the demand from her clients. Her plans are to help her parents with the family expenses and in the future build a small house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to cover the demand from clients.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha trabaja en un puesto de salud de localidad donde vive, atendiendo a pacientes de toda edad, es casada con un hijo a su cargo al que apoyo para su desarrollo académico, actualmente presenta un problema de índole familiar lo que le permitió tomar la sabia decisión de visitar la oficina de ceprodel para ser apoyada con un crédito el que utilizaría en gastos personales y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Martha works at a local center in the town that she lives in, attending to patients of all ages. She is married with a child in her care, whose academic development she supports. Right now a family problem has presented itself, and she made the wise decision to visit the Ceprodel office for help with a loan. She will use it for personal expenses, and in this way will improve her living conditions and standard of life.

loans.use: with personal family expenses.

loans.name: Javier Alejandro

texts.es: Javier  es un hombre dedicado al desarrollo de su familia es propietario de un negocio de destace de res de la cual tiene 9 años de ejercerlo es casado con un hijo a su cargo, su esposa es maestra de educación primaria ya que en conjunto buscan la mejoría del hogar, este señor se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de reses para  satisfacer la demanda de la población   ya que   de esta manera mejoría sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Javier is a man who is dedicated to his family's development.  He owns a beef butchering shop, which he has run for nine years.  Javier is married with one dependent son.  His wife is a primary school teacher, and together they are looking to improve their home.  Javier came to Ceprodel's offices to request a loan that will be used to purchase livestock to meet the demand in his area.  In this way, he will improve his condition and his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for butchering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Fredy Arsenio

texts.es:
Fredy, es casado, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos; trabaja desde hace 12 años en el cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) y ofrece el servicio de albañilería, estos oficios los aprendió de su papá, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., ya cuenta con clientes que compran sus granos. 
Requiere de un préstamo para comprar de contado abono, semilla, fertilizantes y herbicidas, para la siembra de granos básicos, espera que su cosecha sea abundante para tener alimento para su familia y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando año con año, mejorar la productividad, tener mejores ingresos, cancelar su deuda y dar a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
Fredy is married and lives with his family, his wife and his three children. He has worked for 12 years growing basic grains (corn and beans) and offers construction services as well. He learned these trades from his father. He works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and has clients who purchase his grains.

He needs this loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to plant basic grains. He hopes that his harvest is abundant so that he can feed his family and deliver on his clients' requests.

His dreams are to continue working year by year, to improve his productivity, to have more income, to pay off his debt and to give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers and insecticides in cash for planting basic grains.

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es: Cruz   es una mujer   preocupada por la enseñanza de los demás  de profesión de maestra de educación primaria   desde hace 22 años tiene una relación estable de la cual han procreado dos hijos a los que les brinda su apoyo para su desarrollo, esta señora se presento a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para mejorar una vivienda como es la construcción de un cuarto el que utilizaría para compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, hierro, ladrillo, perlines, zinc, arena, piedrín, hierro liso, arena piedrín alambre de amarre, clavos y mano de obra el cual le vendrá a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: Cruz is a woman who is concerned with the education of others.  She is a primary school teacher and has been in the profession for 22 years.  Cruz is in a stable relationship, from which she has produced two children.  She supports her children in their development.  Cruz came to Ceprodel to request a loan to make some improvements to her house; she will build another room.  The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, bricks, roofing beams, zinc, sand, gravel, straight iron, mooring wire and nails and to pay for labor.  This project will improve her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Juana Alide

texts.es: Juana es una señora de profesión maestra de educación primaria, casada con un hijo a su cargo al que le proporciona su apoyo para su desarrollo academica, esta señora se presento a ceprodel con el objetivo de obtener un financiamiento para solventar un problema familiar ya que el mismo será invertido  en gastos personales de que requiere y de esa manera mejorar las de condiciones de vida
texts.en: Juana is a woman who is a primary school teacher by profession.  She is married and has one dependent son.  She gives him her support in his academic development.  Juana came to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a loan to resolve a family problem.  The loan will be invested in personal expenses for items she needs in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: with personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: Doña María es una señora que por 37 años  ha trabajado como afanadora  en un centro de salud de su comunidad es soltera, sin hijos a su cargo pero con la necesidad de resolver un problema familiar por  lo tanto visito a ceprodel  y de esa manera solicitar un crédito el cual lo utilizaría  para cubrir gastos personales que hoy necesita y de esta manera mejora sus condiciones de vida
texts.en: Maria is a woman who for 37 years has worked as a helper in a health center in her community.  She is single without children to take care of, but with a need to resolve a family problem for which she visited Ceprodel and in this way to request a loan which she would use to cover personal expenses and in this way improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to make personal use.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman who has been working in selling home products for ten years. She started her business to help her husband in making their living and to fill her free time with something productive and useful, she says.

She is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a van for distributing her husband's business products because he is working hard on developing his business and expanding his working zone.

She is a hardworking woman, with a special trading talent and a remarkable reputation.

Fatima is working on expanding and developing her business, and this was obvious through the increased business capital which reflected positively on her income.

loans.use: to buy a van for distributing her husband's business products because he is working hard on developing his business and expanding his working zone.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry worked in the hospitality industry for many years. Gaining valuable business and customer service experience, Henry saw the opportunity to go into business for himself. He saw the need for a reliable and easy transportation option for tourists. With the latest rage being in eco-friendly transportation, he established his Hybrid-Electric Bike Rental. 

These E-bikes allow tourists to tour and sight-see where buses and large tours are restricted. Using his hospitality-based background and the popularity of his business, Henry has established relationships with the concierges at many top hotels. Henry’s business allows customers to either rent or purchase one of his E-bikes. So far, he has sold over 100 bikes, as well as establishing himself in three dealerships. 

With an increase in popularity, Henry’s business needs more space and more merchandise. He will use the loan to purchase newer bikes to sell and rent. He needs the loan to fulfill an order with the manufacturer to deal with the busy summer months.

loans.use: to order more inventory of newer bikes to sell and rent.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 61 years old and married with six children.  

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Guillerma has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jacqueline Roxana

texts.es:
Jacqueline, es madre soltera, vive con su hija la cual está estudiando 7° grado; para poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades ella emprendió su negocio que consiste en atender una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y venta de antojitos como yuca, tostadas, enchiladas, etc., su negocio ya tiene 11 años de estar funcionando, en sus inicios lo a hacía de manera ambulante, de esta manera lo realizo durante 4 años, posteriormente lo fundo en la acera de su casa.
Comprará yuca, plátanos, boquitas, dulces, etc., para surtir el inventario de su negocio con productos que sus clientes demandan a diario, como toda persona responsable se limitara a comprar lo básico y espera recuperar la inversión con un buen margen de ganancias las cuales serán el respaldo para el pago de la deuda.
Jaqueline tiene sus sueños los cuales son ampliar su negocio para contar con los recursos económicos con los que pueda apoyar a su hija en convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a single mother, and she lives with her daughter who is in 7th grade. To be able to fulfill her responsibilities, Jacqueline started her business which is a store that sells basic goods and snacks such as yucca, tostadas, enchiladas, etc. Her business has been operational for 11 years. At the beginning, she went from door to door selling her goods, she did this for 4 years. Later, she opened her store near her home. 

She will purchase yucca, bananas, snacks and candies to stock the inventory of her store with products that her clients request every day. Just like any responsible person, she will only buy basic goos, and she hopes to make up the investment with a good profit margin, which will be how she will pay back the debt.

Jacqueline dreams of expanding her business to have more economic resources with which to support her daughter so that she can become a professional worker.

loans.use: to purchase yucca, bananas, snacks and candies to stock the inventory of her business with products that her clients ask for every day.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana  es una señora que por espacio de 34 largas años  ha laborado en centro de salud  de la localidad donde vive, desempeñándose como afanadora, esta señora es madre soltera   con un nieto a su cargo. actualmente está presentando un problema familiar por eso solicito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual utilizarlos en gastos personales y de esta manera mejoras sus condiciones de vida
texts.en: Ana is a woman who, in the space of 34 long years, has worked in her neighborhood's health center doing menial jobs.  She is a "single grandmother" who takes care of her grandson.  Ana is currenlty facing a family problem, which is why she came to Ceprodel's offices to request a loan.  She will use the loan for personal expenses that will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: with personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, surtirá el inventario de su negocio y se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar maíz, aceite, chicharrón, frijoles, etc., para continuar elaborando la venta de pupusas y generando ingresos para subsistir con sus seres queridos.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior María compro la materia prima para su negocio de esta manera mantenerlo funcionando, su condición económica no ha variado mucho más sin embargo cumple con todas sus obligaciones y puede brindar un estilo de vida más digno a su familia.
texts.en: María wants to stock the inventory for her business and has decided to ask for a new loan to buy corn, oil, pork, beans, etc. to continue making and selling stuffed tortillas for survival with her loved ones. With her last loan, María bought raw materials for her business in order to keep it running. Her economic situation hasn't changed much but nevertheless it pays all of the bills and can provide a decent lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, pork, beans, etc. to keep making and selling stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José es una persona de 39 años de edad, muy trabajador y responsable con excelentes principios morales y espirituales, es muy conocido en su comunidad  por su amabilidad y carisma que lo caracteriza como una excelente persona por su buena educación y servicio a los demás. Vive con su familia formada por su esposa que se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, además vive con sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

 José se dedica a la agricultura especialmente, a la siembra de granos básicos como lo son: maíz, frijoles y maicillo.  Él se creció con su padre y sus abuelos y su nivel educativo es de 3º grado y el motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue porque su familia no contaba con los recursos económicos a medida que trascurrió el tiempo él adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.
