José se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde que era muy pequeño, pues la aprendió de su padre y su abuelo quienes le inculcaron buenos principios y valores y es lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad tiene 25 años de experiencia en la agricultura que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos; ya que vende casi el 40% de sus cosechas y la demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 2 km de su casa y a realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda en horarios de 7:00 am a 11:00 am


El dinero será utilizado para comenzar a preparar la tierra,  ya que para la temporada agrícola que se acerca necesita rentar una nueva parcela de tierra porque comenzara a cultivar frijol y maicillo de esta manera tendrá parcelas de cultivo más diversificadas lo cual le dará una mayor fuente de ingresos al momento de vender las cosechas que serán invertidas en mejoramiento de su vivienda.


Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus parcelas y diversificar sus cultivos, en cuanto a sus hijos apoyar en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos quiere prepararse y estudiar para ingeniero en construcciones, y todo esto lo va lograr con la inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de créditos para la agricultura.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, a hardworking and responsible person with good moral and spiritual values. He's well known in his community for his friendliness and carisma. He is characterized as an excellent person because of his politeness and service to others. He lives with his family- his wife and two children. His wife works as a housewife and his children go to the local school. 

José works in farming, specifically he sows basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. He grew up with his father and his grandparents, and he has a third grade level education. The reason he didn't continue with school was because his family didn't have the financial resources and as time went on he gained a lot of experience and knowledge about farming, which has become his primary source of income. 

José has worked as a farmer since he was very little. He learned it from his father and grandfather who instilled in him good principles and values, which is what has lead him to be a well known and respected person in the community. He has 25 years of experience in farming. He sells almost 40% of his harvest and the rest he keeps for his family. He works 2 km from his house and one of his children comes to help from 7:00 am to 11:00 am.

The money will be used to start to prepare the land, as the farming season is getting close and he needs to rent a new plot of land to begin growing beans and sorghum. This way he will have plots of land that are more diversified which will give him a better source of income upon selling his crops. His earnings will be invested in improving his home.

His future goals are to expand his land and diversify his crops. As far as his kids go, he would like to support them in whatever is necessary to prepare them academically, as one of his children would like to study to become a contruction engineer. He will achieve all of this with the investment of his earnings and good use of the new loan, as he already has a lot of experience with farming loans.

loans.use: to start to prepare his land, as the farming season is getting close and he needs to rent a new plot of land to begin growing beans and sorghum. This way he will have plots of land that are more diversified which will give him a better source of income upon selling his crops. His earnings will be invested in improving his home.

loans.name: Erika Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Erika de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, lácteos, refrescos, pollo y embutidos y vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña Erika es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como pollo, mortadela, menudos, quesillo, mantequilla, leche, huevos, azúcar, etc. para surtir su negocio.
Doña Erika con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo darle una buena educación a su hija para que tenga un futuro mejor. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto de 2014
texts.en:
Señora Erika, who is 37, lives with her husband and her daughter in their own house. For 10 years she has had a business of selling donuts, dairy products, soft drinks, chicken, and sausages. She lives in a village in the south of Honduras.

Doña Erika is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead, and she strives day after day to improve her quality of life. She is applying for the loan to buy products such as chicken, bologna, giblets, soft cheese, butter, milk, eggs, sugar, etc., to stock her business.

With the help of this loan, Doña Erika intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time to give a good education to her daughter so that she has a better future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, bologna, giblets, soft cheese, butter, milk, eggs, sugar, and so forth, for her business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 37 años de edad, es una persona muy educado y muy responsable y una excelente personalidad que se dedica a la agricultura como profesión, es una actividad que heredó de su padre quien le enseño.

Él vivió con su padre a quien le ayudaba en las tareas agrícolas todos los días por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes asistía a la escuela donde curso hasta el 4° grado, motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios,  fue porque su padre una persona de edad muy avanzada  comenzó a sentirse mal de salud hasta el punto que falleció y fue él quien desde ese momento retomo el puesto de su padre  en el cual le tocaba trabajar muy fuerte para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la cual está compuesta por su madre y sus 3 hermanas. Desde entonces Alejandro se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y al destazo de cerdos, actividad a la cual se suman su madre y sus hermanas.  

Alejandro realiza el trabajo de la agricultura desde los 15 años, actividad que aprendió de su padre quien con mucho orgullo trabajaba y cultivaba.

Alejandro, en la actividad se dedica al comercio en compra y venta de verduras y productos básicos y  todos los fines de semana se dedica al destazo de cerdos la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que tiene 6 meses de haber comenzado con esta actividad.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar zanahorias, güisquil, lechugas, rábanos, ejotes, papas, plátanos, etc. y en consolidar una deuda personal, de esta forma mejorara su negocio y sus ingresos y prestara un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de tener un vehículo,  para trasportar su mercadería y le permita llevar su negocio a otros caseríos de su comunidad, mejorar su vivienda comenzar a montar una granja de cerdos y de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 37 years old. He is a very polite and responsible person with a great personality. He is a farmer which his father taught him. He lived with his father who he helped with the farming duties every day in the mornings. In the afternoons he attended school until the 4th grade. He couldn't continue studying because his father was elderly and his health began to deteriorate and he passed away. Alejandro took over for his father and began working very hard to provide for his family which is made up of his mother and his three sisters. Since then he has done the farming duties and the butchering of pigs, which his mother and sisters also help with. He began working in farming 15 years ago and learned from his father who worked with pride.

Alejandro also buys and sells vegetables and basic products. He works every weekend butchering pigs which has become his main source of income, and he's been doing this for 6 months.

The loan he's asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy carrots, chayote, lettuce, radishes, green beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. He will also use it to consolidate a personal debt which will improve his business, increase his earnings and he will be able to provide a better service to his customers.

His future projections include having a vehicle to transport goods which will allow him to take his business to other villages within his community. He would like to make home improvements and to start a pig and hen farm.

loans.use: to buy carrots, chayote, lettuce, radishes, green beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. He will also use it to consolidate a personal debt which will improve his business, increase his earnings and he will be able to provide a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Tagaigul

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Тагайгул. Ей 53 года. Она разведенная женщина, у нее четверо взрослых детей. Двое обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно. Тагайгул с двумя младшими детьми живет в районе Рудаки. Пять лет назад она начала предпринимательскую деятельность. Тагайгул занимается продажей продуктов питания и ее продуктовый магазин расположен в хорошем месте. За счет продаж она обеспечивает свою семью. Тагайгул берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов и таким образом увеличить объем продаж. Она надеется на этот кредит.
texts.en: Meet Tagaigul, a 53-year-old divorced woman and the mother of four adult children.  Two of her children already have left the home to start their own families. Tagaigul lives with her two younger children in the Rudaki district.  She started her own business five years ago and sells food products.  Her grocery store is located in a good neighborhood.  Thanks to this business, Tagigul is able to provide for her family.  She is taking a loan to increase her assortment of goods, attract more customers, and increase her sales volume.  She is relying on this loan.

loans.use: to buy food products for her shop.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a married man born in 1985. 

In 2009, Ibrahim opened his own poultry shop. He has 11 years of experience in this domain. In addition to selling fresh chicken, he prepares and sells special tasty sandwiches requested by most of his customers.

Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his merchandise sales by buying new Broasted and smoothie machines. He can then diversify his shop’s provided services by offering tasty sandwiches and refreshing drinks. 

Ibrahim hopes to expand his work more, increase his income, and save profits for the future.

loans.use: to buy new Broasted and smoothie machines.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, con la inversión del crédito anterior obtuvo una mejor cosecha, la condición económica ha mejorado por el aumento de las ventas, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida y mantiene el mismo número de miembros.
Para continuar con su negocio funcionando se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagará de mano de obra  para sembrar la milpa de postrera, esperando tener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
With the investment of the previous loan, Maria obtained a better harvest, and her economic conditions have improved through the increase in her sales. Her family has a better lifestyle and maintains the same number of members.

In order to keep her business functioning, she decided to take out a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor to plant the last cornfield, hoping to have good results.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor to plant the final cornfield.

loans.name: Martha Estela

texts.es:
Martha de 24 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios y valores, los que la han llevado a ser una mujer muy reconocida en su comunidad, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar también se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde. Martha vivió y se creció junto a sus padres quienes eran personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que también se dedicaban a la venta de pollos y huevos ya que trabajaban en una granja propia de gallinas ponedoras su familia contaba con 3 hermanos siendo ella la mayor de todos a quien le correspondía ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y en la granja. 

Martha se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar desde los 12 años actividad que aprendió de sus padres y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde y a la venta de huevos ya que posee una granja de 50 gallinas ponedoras y 50 pollos de engorde realizando estas actividades lleva más de 10 años y continuara haciéndolo ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de donde les proporciona ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos a esta actividad se suma su esposo y lo hace por las tardes, ya que las mañanas las dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura.

El dinero será utilizado en compra de pollos y gallinas ponedoras, ya que las que se le han agotado las existencias y tendrá que comprar más gallinas y pollos y también  una parte del dinero será invertido en compra de repuestos para bicicleta ya que su esposo ha comenzado a realizar esta prestación de servicio, lo que traerá un nuevo ingreso a su familia.

Los sueños que ella tiene para un futuro son las de tener una granja,  con las mejores instalaciones, y adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de una incubadora de esta forma tendrá mejores ingresos y apoyar el la educación de su hijo y apoyar a su esposo al mejoramiento de las instalaciones de su taller.
texts.en:
Martha,24, is a person with excellent principles and values, which have brought her to be a woman well-recognized in her community.  She makes a living doing housework in her home and she makes a living raising and selling fattening chickens.  Martha lived and grew up with her parents who were very humble and hard-working people who also made a living selling chickens and eggs since they worked in their own laying hen farm.  Her family consisted of three siblings of which she was the oldest meaning that she had to help with the chores around the house and the farm.
Martha makes a living doing the domestic activities in her home, which she learned from her parents, since she was 12 and she also makes a living raising fattening chickens and selling eggs since she has a farm with 50 laying hens and 50 fattening chickens.  She has been doing this for over 10 years and will continue to do it since it has become the principal source of income which gives them profits to satisfy the basic necessities of her children.  Her husband joins her in this activity during the afternoons, since in the morning he works in agriculture.
The money will be used to buy chickens and laying hens, since those that she has have surpassed their useful lives and she has to buy more hens and chickens and also part of the money will be invested in bicycle parts since her husband has started to offer this service which will bring them new income for the family.
Her dreams for the future are to have a farm with better equipment and get a new loan to buy an incubator and in this way have more income, to support  the education of her son, and to support her husband to improve the equipment in his shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens, since those she has have surpassed their useful lives and she has to buy hens and chickens and also part of the money will be invested in the purchase of bicycle parts since her husband has started to offer this service, which will bring them a new income for the family.

loans.name: Jactone

texts.en:
Jactone is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

He operates a transport business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area. Jactone describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will have a transport company. He will use the anticipated profits to manage bills and expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meat vending. 

Josefina is borrowing 29,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Melissa has been in this business for four years. Melissa earns additional income from fishing and fish vending.

Melissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, se dedica  a cultivar maíz, hojas de tabaco, frijol y maicillo, en ocasiones trabaja como jornalero, son actividades que heredó de su padre, a medida fue creciendo se fue independizando e inicio a realizar sus propios cultivos, ya tiene más de 20 años de tener su negocio y hasta la fecha se mantiene realizando los viveros de los diferentes cultivos para luego venderlos. Héctor vive en con sus padres, su compañera de vida y dos hijos que están estudiando nivel básico. 
Utilizará el crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes y pagara arrendamiento del terreno y mozos, le será de ayuda para fortalecer su negocio y continuar teniendo ingresos económicos para cubrir sus obligaciones.
Héctor anhela tener una mejor situación económica para terminar de construir su vivienda, comprar sus propios terrenos para continuar cultivando, apoyar a su esposa para que inicie su propio negocio y dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Héctor works cultivating corn, tobacco leaves, beans and sorghum. Sometimes he works as a day laborer. These are activities that he inherited from his father. As he grew up, he began to be more independent and started his own crops. 

He has had his business for more than 20 years, and until this day he has kept it by making a nursery of different crops and then selling them. Héctor lives with his parents, his life partner and his two children who are in elementary school. 

He will use the loan to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers, and to pay for the rent and labor of the land.  This will be of great help to strengthen his business and continue with his incomes to cover his financial obligations.

Héctor wishes to be in better economic conditions  so he can finish building his house, buy his own land to continue with his crops, support his wife so she can start her own business and keep providing an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers, and to pay for the rent and labor of the land.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, se ha decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para mejorar su negocio, invertirá en insumos para la sastrería,  comprándose telas, hilos, botones, broches, agujas, etc., así seguirá teniendo las entradas de dinero que necesita para costear sus compromisos.
El impacto que el préstamo anterior ha tenido en su negocio es muy positivo, pues mantiene su negocio funcionando, sus ingresos son mayores, hoy ya se ahorrar en el vestuario pues ya no compra ropa prefabricada.
texts.en:
Mirna has decided to apply for a new loan to improve her business. She will invest in sewing supplies, buying fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners, needles, etc. Thus she will continue having the income needed to pay her obligations.

The impact that the previous loan has had on her business is very positive, since it keeps her business going. Her income is greater. Now she saves on her wardrobe, since she doesn't buy prefabricated clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, fasteners, needles, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mercedes está caracterizada por ser una mujer que le gusta el trabajo, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y de su hogar, una mujer donde los años no la afectan y en su lugar es como hacerse más joven. A sus 49 años de edad comenzó su propio negocio luego de haber trabajado en el magisterio de su localidad, ya se 12 años de la fundación de su negocio que lo ha visto su crecer y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Actualmente ella requiere de un préstamo para mejorar su servicio higiénico ya que el que posee ahorita no presta las mejores condiciones para su familia porque fue afectado por los sismos ocurridos en el país los meses anteriores. Mercedes estima que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá brindarle a una mejor estabilidad y prosperidad a su familia. Las principales metas de Mercedes son la construcción de dos cuartos para rentárselos a estudiantes y de esta forma obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is characterized for being a woman who likes to work, to improve her family’s quality of life and her home. She is a woman who is not affected by the years, and instead it is like becoming younger. At 49 years old, she opened her own business after having worked in her town’s magisterium. It has been 12 years since she established her own business that she has seen grown, and it has better her income. 

Presently, she is requesting a loan to fix her toilette because the one she has does not provide the best conditions for her family (it was affected by the earthquakes that happened in the country in the previous months). Mercedes estimates that the loan she is requesting will help her a lot because she will be able to give her family better stability and prosperity. 

The main goal of Mercedes is to build two rooms to rent to students, and that way obtain a better income.

loans.use: to improve her toilette

loans.name: Murodgul

texts.ru:
Муродгул добрая общительная женщина с городка Дангара. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и у нее две дочери в возрасте 16 и 17 лет, и 14-летний сын. Муж Муродгул работает в России в качестве трудового мигранта. Поэтому Муродгул сама следит за воспитанием детей. Одновременно она у себя дома занимается животноводческим бизнесом. Год назад она начала выращивать коров и бычков для продажи. Ее научил этому делу брат мужа. По словам Муродгул в деятельности ей нравится то, что она всегда обеспечена молоком и молочными продуктами, и стабильным доходом. 
На сумму запрашиваемого кредита Муродгул собирается купить несколько голов бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Она надеется, что ее поддержат, чтобы она смогла расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Murodgul comes from the town of Danghara.  She is a kind and sociable 42-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two daughters (ages 17 and 16) and a 14-year-old son.  Murodgul's husband is a migrant worker and he is currently in Russia.  For this reason, Murodgul takes care of her children's education  alone.  At the same time, she is involved in animal husbandry at home.  She started to raise cows and young bulls for resale a year ago and was initiated into the business by her brother-in-law.   According to Murodgul, what she likes the most about this activity is the fact that it always provides her with milk and dairy products, as well as with a stable income.  Murodgul plans to use the amount of her loan to buy a few head of young cattle in order to increase her number of domestic animals.  She is hoping to receive some support, which will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a few head of young cattle to increase her herd.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.en: Shodigul is a hard-working married father of three who lives in a rural area with his family. Shodigul’s wife has been busy with bringing up their children. Shodigul is the only breadwinner for his family. He began his business selling food items 12 years ago. He sells all kinds of food items in his shop, which is located near his house, and his neighbors are his customers. Shodigul is going to increase his working capital and in this way maximize profit. His parents also live with him. He needs money to provide his large family with all necessary things. Shodigul is asking for a loan of $2,500 (USD) to buy food items for increasing working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila de 57  años de edad, es casada no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia y se dedica desde hace  07  años al negocio de venta de pasteles para toda ocasión,  su venta es en su casa  y en el mercado de el municipio donde vive.
Doña Petronila sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario le vistan  en su negocio, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de harina, huevos, jaleas, vainilla, soda, leche, azúcar, etc. que son parte de los insumos que necesita para elaborar sus pasteles.
Doña Petronila espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante en su negocio y poder apoyar a su familia, es el quinto préstamo que solicita a Prisma y está contenta por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Petronila, 57, is married and has no dependent children.  She lives in her own house and has earned a living for seven years in her business selling cakes for all occasions.  Her shop is in her house and in the market in the town where she lives.

Petronila's customers are her friends and people who go to her business every day.  She's a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy flour, eggs, jelly, vanilla, baking soda, milk, and sugar, which are some of the ingredients she needs to make her cakes.

Petronila hopes this investment will allow her to earn the income she needs to get ahead in her business and be able to support her family.  It's the fifth loan she has requested from Prisma and she's happy for the support she has received.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2014

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, jelly, vanilla, baking soda, milk, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married mother of five children. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of fish. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fish. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as principled. She operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour, eggs and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour, maize flour and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more wheat flour, maize flour and other items

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She also has been selling coconuts for years, and she earns well from this. 

Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple has to work hard with the determination of having better income. They want to provide their children with a better education that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Yulita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional coconuts. With an amount of 9,000 PHP, she can already improve and expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Yulita hopes to grow her business more. She also dreams of improving the general living conditions of her family. 

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. The fellowship meeting is where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and the ingredients for bean curd pudding.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva works hard to support her family. Oliva is married and has a business selling herbal products in the Philippines.

Oliva requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials and ingredients for her business.

Oliva has been in this business for two years now.

Oliva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, se ve en la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en su negocio y opta por un nuevo préstamo para adquirir embutidos, repollos, pollo, carnes y otros materiales para continuar elaborando la venta de antojitos, pupusas y comida.
La ayuda que se le brinda a través de créditos a Milagro es bien administrada, la demanda de sus productos son mayores, su situación económica es más favorable, cumple con el pago de sus deudas y sobre todo junto a su familia  vive en un entorno más confortable.
texts.en:
Milagro saw the necessity of investing in her business again and opted for a new loan to acquire sausages, cabbages, chicken, meats, and other materials to continue making snacks, pupusas [filled corn tortillas, a typical Salvadoran dish], and other dishes to sell.

The help that is offered to Milagro through the loans is managed well. The demand for her products is greater. Her economic situation is more favorable. She makes the payments on her debts, and above all, she and her family live in more comfortable surroundings.

loans.use: to acquire sausages, cabbages, chicken, meats, and other materials to continue selling snacks, pupusas, and food.

loans.name: Mohini

texts.en:
Mohini is a 45-year-old woman who lives in a small village, Upenpally, in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and their five daughters. All their daughters are students. Both Mohini and her husband have elementary education. She studied up to grade 8 and her husband up to grade 9.

Mohini is a housewife. Her husband Bhabesh, aged 53 years, has a wood business. He purchases wood from the villagers. He resells it to the retail customers and different furniture shops. He established this retail business many years back and has been continuing until now. He works at the business every day from morning to night.  But his income is scanty to bear all the expenses of such a large family.  He wants to expand his business but he says that his major problem is capital, as the prices of wood are increasing day by day.

To help her husband to continue with his business, Mohini has taken a loan from BJS. She plans to utilize the loan to buy timber from the villagers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business and start a saw mill for them.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for the existing business.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en: Zulola was born in 1983 and is the mother of three children. Zulola lives with her husband and three children in the south part of Tajikistan. Her husband is a taxi driver. Zulola began her own animal husbandry business 13 years ago because she needed money. She feeds milk cows. Zulola sells milk and milk products to local people. With profit from her business, she improves her living conditions little by little. Zulola is going to increase the number of cows to sell more milk and milk products. Zulola is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a cow. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more cereals

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 38 years old, married and has three children, one currently in school.

Simplicia is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Simplicia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Simplicia has been raising cattle for 12 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Simplicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bread, sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy more  bread, sugar and other items

loans.name: Dúo Gloria A Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Gloria a Dios dúo esta conformado por la señora Silvia de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos ya que ha tenido mucha demanda de sus clientes, el sueño de ella es tener un local donde exibir su producto espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Dúo Gloria a Dios is comprised of Mrs. Silvia, who is 21 years old. For several years she has produced and sold typical weavings. For this opportunity, she is asking for a loan to purchase raw material for the production and sale of typical weavings. She has already had many requests from her clients. Her dream is to have a place to exhibit her products, and she hopes that you can help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the production and sale of typical weavings.

loans.name: Luís Rey

texts.es:
Luis de 26 años de edad, es un muchacho emprendedor, estudió hasta bachillerato, vive solo junto con su mamá, su padre ya falleció y tiene tres hermanos viviendo en estados unidos, que son los que le ayudan económicamente a su madre.

Luis es amante de la música y su negocio consiste en instalar el equipo musical para amenizar las fiestas. Todo comenzó como un pasatiempo, cuando un amigo le dijo que fueran a una fiesta y que él pusiera la música y el otro pondría los parlantes y el equipo auditivo, poco a poco los fueron llamando para más eventos, y así fue que Luis decidió dedicarse de lleno a esto y se independizo, ahora el negocio marcha bien, pero siempre necesita irse actualizando.

Luis necesita el dinero, porque quiere comprar unas pantallas en las cuales pueda reproducir los videos de sus canciones y así la gente pueda disfrutar más cuando participen de una fiesta.

Luis sueña con llegar a tener más equipo musical y más moderno para así abastecer varios eventos a la vez, y pueda llegar a formar su propio hogar y darle una mejor vida a su madrecita.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 26 years old, is an entrepreneurial young man. He graduated from high school. He alone lives with his mother. His father died, and he has three brothers living in the United States, who are the ones who help his mother economically.

Luis loves music, and his business consists of installing musical equipment to liven up parties. Everything began as a hobby when a friend told him that they were going to a party and that he would set up the music and the other could set up the speakers and the audio equipment. Little by little they were called for more events, and thus it was that Luis decided to fully devote himself to this and become independent. Now the business is going well, but it always needs to be updated.

Luis needs the money because he wants to buy some screens on which he can reproduce the videos of his songs and thus the people can enjoy them more when they participate in a party.

Luis dreams of having more musical equipment that is more modern in order to thus supply several events at once, being able to form his own household, and giving a better life to his dear mother.

loans.use: to buy some screens in which he can reproduce the videos of his songs, and thus people can enjoy them more when they participates in a party

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 53 years old and married with four children.  

Teofila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teofila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teofila has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teofila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio, a resident of Miami, Florida, saw a need for business consulting in his area. For over five years, Sergio has run International Service Providers. Based out of his home, he provides professional business consulting services to local businesses. 

With years of dedication to his profession, Sergio has gained invaluable experience. In addition, he offers a wide range of services, including developing marketing plans, promoting material use, developing marketing strategies, and employee recruiting. 

Sergio needs a loan to purchase equipment and invest in marketing. Expanding is a goal, but Sergio cannot achieve this without more cash flow. He envisions his company to be the premier consulting service in his area and provide local business with the information and tools they need to thrive.

loans.use: To enlarge the business, make payroll, and purchase supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Why not get fit? Adam, a resident of Cleveland, Ohio, asked himself this one day. 125 lbs later, Adam’s personal success story transitioned into a passion for fitness. This passion became Fierce Fitness CLE. Well-known for his weight loss success, Adam’s fitness classes became a hit. His story spread rapidly as he was featured on “LIVE” with Kelly and Michael…becoming the #1 Fitness Instructor in Cleveland. Adam and his two employees offer a wide range of fitness classes. With a growing fan base, Adam occasionally has to sub his mom in to teach a Zumba class! His popularity has become a double-edged sword; Adam struggles to find time slots for all of his eager customers. 

Adam will use his loan to purchase spin bikes for his fitness studio. This will allow for a broader range of classes, and draw in a much wider customer base. Spinning has become a rapidly growing trend, and purchasing those spin bikes will allow Adam to keep up.

loans.use: To purchase spin bikes

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Originally from Brazil, Elida thought the language barrier would restrict her from owning her own business. After years of working for other cleaning services, she decided she could do better and gave herself a shot. 

With a part-time helper, Elida runs her own cleaning service. She is now able to work for herself and support her family. Elida wants to be able to expand and sign into cleaning contracts. Unfortunately, this is becoming very expensive. Elida needs a loan to be able to expand and ensure a bright financial future for her and her family.

loans.use: To expand and invest in more contracts

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking married woman with seven children. For the past three years she has sold dried fish, which can be a challenge when there aren’t enough to buy and then sell.

Jane is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP to buy more stocks of fish. She hopes that in the future her sales will grow ever larger.

loans.use: buy more stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in marketing and business development

loans.name: Tamra

texts.en:
Passionate about style and clothing, Tamra was destined to enter into the world of fashion design. Spurred on by her keen eye for style and new trends, Tamra established Octavious Boutique. She noticed that while there were many well-liked fashion postings on Instagram, there was no way to purchase an item if a viewer liked it. She decided to combine this element with her own fashion company.

Tamra will find styles that she likes and post them on her website, offering them to interested internet users. Prices will range from $35 to $140, and all of the merchandise will be hand-picked by her. In order to see her dream become successful, Tamra needs cash flow to kick start her business. She needs a loan to purchase inventory, attract attention via marketing strategies, and develop her website.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has six children ranging in age from fourteen to twenty years. When asked, she describes herself as determined.

For the past four years Pamela has locally sold tomatoes and dried fish. She says the biggest challenge to her business is insufficient capital.

This will be Pamela’s first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use 20,000 KES to buy more stocks of tomatoes and fish.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes and fish

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José es un hombre trabajador, a pesar de su poca educación ha sabido salir adelante, junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos, trabajando la tierra y su mujer encargándose de la casa. Sus hijos van a la escuela y esperan algún día ayudar económicamente a su familia.

José se dedica a trabajar la tierra, siembra maíz todos los años. Este año se ha dado el fenómeno del niño y la siembra de primera se perdió, pero en confianza con Dios espera que las lluvias se establezcan para este mes.

El préstamo solicitado, es para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra, como lo son fertilizantes y plaguicidas y así poder obtener una buena producción.

José sueña con tener buenas cosechas con sus cultivos, para así poder darles una mejor vida a su esposa y sus hijos y que ellos crezcan viendo el ejemplo de un padre trabajador.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working man. Despite having little education, he has managed to get ahead in life along with his wife and two children, by farming while his wife looks after the home. His children go to school and hope to help the family financially some day. Jose earns a living by farming; he grows corn every year. This year, the El Niño weather phenomenon caused him to lose his first planting, but he places his confidence in God and hopes that the rain will settle down this month.

The loan requested is for buying farming supplies for sowing, such as fertilizers and insecticides, in order to have a good crop. Jose hopes to have good harvests for his crops and thus be able to provide a better life to his wife and children. He wants his children to grow up seeing the example of a hard-working father.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jessie Boy

texts.en:
Jessie Boy is married with three children. For the past fifteen years he has made a living by fishing, which he is happy to say has helped his family a lot.

In order to improve his fishing boat Jessie Boy has borrowed 20,000 PHP through GDMPC to buy nets and spare parts for it. He strives for a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy nets and spare parts for his boat

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru:
Орзугул молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 31 года. Она замужем за мастера строителя. У них двое замечательных мальчиков, им по 7 и 4 года. Старший сын в этом году пойдет в первый класс. 
Орзугул раньше не работала, ее дети были маленькими и она следила за ними. После того как ее дети подросли, полтора года назад она начала свой торговый бизнес. Орзугул в их районе Хуросон открыла продуктовый магазин и по сей день она там занимается продажей продуктов питания. В данный момент Орзугул обратилась за кредитом, так как хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине. Она ждет поддержки. Кредит поможет ей увеличить доходность бизнеса.
texts.en:
Orzugul is 31 years old and married to a master builder.  She and her husband have two wonderful boys, ages 7 and 4.  Their oldest son will enter the first year of elementary school this year.

A few years ago, Orzugul didn't use to work: her children were very young and she looked after them. A year-and-a-half ago, when her children became a bit older, she started her own business and opened a grocery store in her own district of Khuroson.  To this day, she is still involved in selling food products.

Orzugul is currently requesting a loan to increase her assortment of goods in her shop.  She is awaiting your support.  This loan will allow her to increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy food products and increase her sales' volume in her store.

loans.name: Juan Baustista

texts.es:
El señor Juan Bautista de 39  años de  edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa,  se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de venta de hamacas, visita a sus clientes frecuentemente para vender sus hamacas y estos son  todos sus vecinos y también personas de las comunidades, pueblos y demás lugares.
Don Juan Bautista les ofrece a sus clientes una buena atención y buenos productos y es por eso que le compran mucho en su negocio, es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Juan Bautista está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de hilos, sedas, agujas, etc. para elaborar hamacas para la venta y así poder cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. 
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto de 2014
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is 39 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife. For six years, he has been earning a living by selling hammocks. He visits his customers frequently to sell his hammocks. His customers are his neighbours and people from the community, the town, and other places. Juan Bautista offers his customers good service and good products, and that is why they buy from him often. He is an enterprising man who wants to succeed, and he strives every day to improve his quality of life. 

Juan Bautista is requesting the loan to buy thread, fabrics, needles, etc, to make hammocks to sell, and thus pay for his and his family's needs. His dream is to grow his business in order to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, needles, etc, for his business.

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 46 ans, Abravi  a deux(2) enfants en charge et habite le quartier de Tokoin. Elle est rentrée dans le commerce depuis 1998 en revendant les friperies  qu’elle achète à Hezdranawè une fois par mois. Abravi revend au grand marché de Lomé  et les environs.Abravi sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce de 1 ballot d’habit d’enfant, d’adulte et des pantalons en diversifiant le choix des friperies et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Married and 46 years old, Abravi has two children to support and lives in the Tokoin district. She went back to commerce in 1998 to sell secondhand clothing, which she purchases in Hezdranawè once a month. Abravi resells her goods in and around the big market of Lomé. She is requesting a loan to increase her business with a bale of clothing for children and adults and some pants, thus diversifying the choices of used clothing, as well as to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothing for children and adults and some pants

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est mariée et mère de Trois(3) enfants dans le quartier d’Adidomé. Elle est âgée de 39 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de bouillie (maïs) depuis 2013. Pour diversifier son activité, Abla  y ajoute la vente de beignet. Elle s’approvisionne Trois fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa  pour  l’achat  des céréales pour faire la bouillie, et les beignets  puis revend à la devanture de son domicile.Abla  sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock de 20 bols de farine de blé et 50 bols de maïs afin de faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en: Abla is a married mother of three children in the Adidomé district. She is 39 years old and has had a business selling porridge (corn) since 2013. To diversify her business, Abla is including the sale of beignets. She gets her supplies three times a month at the Akodessewa market buying grains for making porridge and beignets. Then she makes her sales in front of her home. Abla is requesting a loan to expand her inventory with 20 bowls of wheat flour and 50 bowls of corn in order to make a considerable profit.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bowls of wheat flour and 50 bowls of corn

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Veuve  âgée de 46 ans, Adjo a deux(2) enfants en charge et habite le quartier de Tokoin. Elle est rentrée dans le commerce en revendant les objets en plastiques  qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé deux  fois par mois. Adjo revend par la vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier de résidence. Adjo sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce avec 2 douzaines de bassine, de plat et de sceau afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: A widow and 46 years old, Adjo has two children to support and lives in the Tokoin district. She has gone back to commerce to sell plasticware, which she purchases at the big market of Lomé. She resells her goods by hawking in the district where she lives. Adjo is requesting a loan to increase her business with 2 dozen tubs, dishes, and buckets in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen tubs, dishes, and buckets

loans.name: Maa Bhairabi Shg Group

texts.en:
From a small village in the Koraput district, Odisha state, India, 10 women stepped out and made a self-help group having the name of "Maa Bhairabi Shg" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Hiramani, age 32, is a married lady with two children. The lady standing with her hand raised is Hiramani. To provide a living, she has been planting rice and farming for seven years. From farming, she earns an income of 3,500 INR per month. Now, she is the leader of this group, and they are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 150,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes she will have a good rice crop yield to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Alokabala

texts.en:
Alokabala is a resident of Maynaguri. She is married and a mother of one son. She is uneducated and can sign her name only. Alokabala is a very active lady, 45 years of age. She lives with her husband and their only son in Vivekananda Pally in Jalpaiguri district. Alokabala's husband, Niren, is engaged in agricultural activities.

They have a vegetable cultivation farm on their own plot of land. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger, onions, etc., on the farm. She sells her products to the traders from the nearest town and those who come to take vegetables from their farm. Alokabala says that their earnings are not as per their expectation from this business. It is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

They want to expand her business by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides for her farm to cultivate paddy, which is a very profitable crop. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Alokabala dreams of constructing a house. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. She conveys her thanks to her generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cultivating paddy on her farmland.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as obedient. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is aged 52, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her income from this business was usually spent on the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient capital in her business, Marina is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, candies, curls, breads, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She also has a mini eatery in front of her retail store to generate additional income. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, toothpaste, candies, curls, breads, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy and competitive place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to have a more profitable business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Daina

texts.en: Daina is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is a widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 9 years to 18 years. She describes herself as self reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Ángela Misaela

texts.es:
Ángela es una mujer de 39 años de edad, madre de 1 hija y dos hijos.  Se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, vela por la salud y la alimentación de su familia.  La señora  se creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar, mientras que su abuelo se dedicaba a la agricultura,  actividad que realizo toda su vida y le sirvió para llevar el sustento diario a su familia, con el paso del tiempo Ángela comenzó a trabajar en un negocio de venta tortillas y fue donde adquirió experiencias y conocimiento, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años y tiene 5 años de haberse independizado y de ser propietaria de su propio negocio.  

Ángela tiene una experiencia de 15 años en realizar la actividad de tortillas y realización de los oficios domésticos para su familia. es una actividad que aprendió de su abuela que fue una señora que dedico toda su vida en realizar esta actividad y fue quien le inculco buenos principios y valores morales los que hoy en día la han llevado a ser una buena persona de éxito para su familia y los conocimientos en la venta de tortillas producto de la experiencia laboral que tubo cuando era una joven y en la actualidad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso a esta actividad se suma sus dos hijas las cuales ya son mayores de edad y su hijo se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una plancha y maíz, de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá un aumento en las ganancias económicas de su negocio. Así podrá  impulsar los estudios de su hijo y mejorara la calidad de vida de sus familiares.


Los planes que la señora tiene para un futuro son los de apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sean un profesional de éxito, ya que manifiesta que su hijo el menor quiere estudiar veterinaria en la universidad nacional, y una de sus hijas quiere estudiar leyes en la universidad nacional, también desea ampliar su negocio y gestionar un nuevo crédito el cual será invertido en un local más amplio, el cual le permita surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela is 39 years old and a mother to one daughter and two sons. Ángela looks after the household chores, feeds her family and takes care of their health. Ángela was raised by her grandmother, who was a housewife; Ángela’s grandfather was a farmer all his life and this work allowed him to support his family. As time went by, Ángela started working at a business selling tortillas. She gained experience and developed her knowledge of the trade. She has been doing this work for fifteen years but five years ago she decided to become independent and start her own business.

Ángela has fifteen years’ experience with tortillas and also looks after the household chores for her family. Ángela learned her skills from her grandmother; she was always a housewife and instilled good principles and values in her granddaughter. To this day, these values have made Ángela a successful person. Her knowledge of selling tortillas, gained from work experience as a young woman, has made this work one of her main sources of income. Ángela’s two daughters – now adults – also help out with the business, while her son is studying at the local school.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy a grill and corn. With these items she can provide her customers with better service and see an increase in profits at the business. Ángela will then be able to help her son with his education and improve the family’s quality of life.

In the future, Ángela wants to support her children’s education so that they may be successful university graduates. Ángela’s son wants to study to be a vet at the state university, while one of her daughter’s wants to study law there. Ángela also wants to expand her business and take out a new loan in order to invest in larger premises. This will allow Ángela to have her business better stocked.

loans.use: to buy a grill and corn. With these items she can provide her customers with better service and see an increase in profits at the business. Ángela will then be able to help her son with his education and improve the family’s quality of life.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
La señora Dorila de  41 años  de edad,  es casada  tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia en una comunidad de San Lorenzo  se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Dorila su venta es en su casa y sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que pasan por la calle y llegan a comprar a su negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca, arroz, azúcar, café, jabón, detergente, churros, frescos, aceites, pastas, jugos, etc. para surtir más el negocio y por ende tener más ganancias. 
Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende  mejorar su calidad de vida y de esa forma mejorar su negocio, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma. Uno de sus  sueños es tener más grande su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Dorila is 41 years old, married and has two children who depend on her. Dorila lives in a house that she owns in a community in San Lorenzo. For five years she has had a grocery store. Dorila is very hard-working and wants to prosper.

Dorila sells her products from her home. Her customers are friends, neighbours and passers-by who come to buy from her business. Dorila is applying for this loan in order to buy flour, butter, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, detergent, churros, soft drinks, oil, pasta, juices and more to stock up her business and thereby increase her profits.

With the support of this loan, Dorila intends to improve her quality of life and make her business better. This is her fourth loan from Prisma Honduras. One of Dorila's dreams is to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, detergent, churros, soft drinks, oil, pasta, juices and more for her business.

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
La señora  María de 40  años  de edad,  es casada  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de su suegra,  se dedica desde hace  10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son amigos y vecinos que la vistan a diario.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leche, pollo, detergentes, jabón, pastas, azúcar, café, etc. para surtir su negocio y así lograr que sus ventas aumenten para obtener las ganancias necesarias para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.
Doña María es su sexto préstamo que solicita a Prisma y está contenta de seguir trabajando con la institución, su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, married and has two children who depend on her. María lives with her mother-in-law and, for ten years, has had a grocery store that she runs out of her home. Her customers are friends and neighbours who come by every day.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy corn, milk, chicken, detergents, soap, pastas, sugar, coffee and more to stock up her business. With these goods, she hopes that her sales will increase and that she will earn higher profits in order to pay for her family's necessities.

This is María's sixth loan from Prisma Honduras and she is happy to continue working with the organisation. María's dream is to own her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, milk, chicken, detergents, soap, pastas, sugar, coffee and more for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su compañero de vida y dos hijos, los cuales son dependientes; siendo una niña aprendió a elaborar tortillas para consumo familiar, debido a la necesidad de mejorar el entorno en el que crecen sus hijos actualmente lo desempeña este oficio como negocio, lo realiza de ocho de la mañana a dos de la tarde, ya ha ganado popularidad en la zona por su buen servicio.
Está solicitando capital para comprar maíz y leña, con esta inversión asegurará la materia prima para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio, además le están ofreciendo a buen precio el producto, espera continuar mejorando su situación económica y responder positivamente a sus compromisos.
Sus aspiraciones son iniciar un nuevo negocio que sea más rentable y así remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her family - her partner and two children, who still depend on their parents. As a girl, Rosa learned to make tortillas for her family to eat. With a need to improve her family environment where her children were growing up, Rosa now sells tortillas to make money. She works from 8am until 2pm and is popular in the local area because she offers good service.

Rosa is applying for this loan in order to buy corn and firewood; this investment will ensure that Rosa has the basic supplies necessary for her business to run smoothly. In addition, Rosa can currently buy these goods at a low price. Rosa hopes to continue improving her financial situation and to make all of her commitments.

Rosa aspires to having a more profitable business. In the future she would like to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood; this investment will ensure that Rosa has the basic supplies necessary for her business to run smoothly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock such as fizzy drinks, liquors, fried snacks, and other consumables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business selling ice creams, soft drinks, fizzy drinks and snacks. The loan will be invested in buying a door, a rug, decorations, paint, stock, a freezer and display cases.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 43 años de edad que no tuvo hijos y a la vez es una gran desventaja pues en su vejez no cuenta con una persona que vele por ella por lo que tiene que buscar la manera de buscar sus recursos para salir adelante y pagar las respectivas  cuentas que tiene toda persona normal.

Gracias a una tienda ha podido sobresalir y tener una vida digna, su tienda no solo es una ayuda para ella si no para las personas del sector que normalmente producen su alimento pero ciertas cosas tienen que ir a la cabecera municipal a conseguirlas y su tienda.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de víveres y abarrotes para surtir su tienda y tener siempre a la mano productos para sus vecinos y todo aquel que llegue solicitando un producto.

Sueña con tener una vejez digna sin pasar necesidades y seguir ayudando a su comunidad con su tienda.
texts.en: Maria is a 43 year old woman who never had children of her own, which is a disadvantage because in her old age she will not have a person taking care of her. Therefore, she has to find the way to find the needed resources to move ahead and pay her own bills like every normal person. Thanks to her shop she has been able to have a decent life. The store does not only help her, but also helps the people of the area who need certain things and come to her shop to find them. She is requesting a loan to buy food and supplies to stock up her store and have products handy for her neighbors and others who come asking for a product. She dreams of having a decent old age free of necessities, and to keep on helping her community with her shop.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Wilmer Manuel

texts.es:
Wilmer desde que era niño aprendió las labores del campo y se enfocó mucho en la compra y venta de animales como ganado, pollos y cerdos. 

Debido a épocas de crisis sus animales han muerto y ha visto como su producción y ganancias se han convertido en perdida y toda su forma de vida se ve seriamente afectada por lo que necesita medidas drásticas para mejorar su situación. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde buscando una alternativa económica pero eficaz para mejorar sus condiciones. 

El crédito el permitirá seguir ejerciendo su labor y apoyar a su familia y esposa.
texts.en:
Wilmer learned all about farming when he was a little boy.  Much of his activity focused on buying and selling animals such as cattle, chickens and pigs.

Due to bad times his animals have died and Wilmer has experienced serious loss in production and earnings, as well as in his lifestyle, which drive him to take drastic measures to improve his situation.

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs to raise and sell in order to seek a sound economic alternative aimed at improving his conditions.  The loan will allow him to continue working in order to support his wife and family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería, vive con sus padres y sus 3 hermanos, no tiene un trabajo formal pero cuando se suele cuidar a personas enfermas, la misma presta su servicio y de esa manera genera un poco de ingreso para gastos de la facultad, su objetivo es trabajar en  los hospitales o sanatorios  y así poder tener buenos ingresos y realizarse como persona y profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Fatima is studying for a nursing degree.  She lives with her parents and three siblings and works, unofficially, taking care of elderly people.  In exchange for her services she earns a small amount of income to cover university expenses.  Her goal is to work in hospitals or health centers so she can earn a good income and realize her personal and professional goals.

The loan she is requesting is to pay university fees.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de28 ans, Adjo  habite avec son mari et son enfant à Tokoin. Restauratrice de Fufu et de la pâte de maïs depuis 2005, Adjo s’approvisionne au marché de Gbossimé une fois par mois  pour l’achat d’ignames et de maïs et après transformation elle revend sous un hangar de location. Adjo sollicite un microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce  afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Adjo, who is 28 years old, lives with her husband and child in Tokoin. She has been preparing fufu and corn dough since 2005. She gets her supplies from the market in Gbossimé once a month, buying yams and corn and then making them up into dishes that she sells in a rented shed. Adjo is requesting a micro-loan so that she can expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn and a "calebasse" of yams.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Sovann is 43 years old, a clay stove maker and a widowed woman with three children. One of her children is a factory worker and one is a student. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $7.50 per day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her child to ride to work because the factory is far from home. This loan will help her reduce her family’s traveling expenses. In the future, she is going to expand her clay stove making and build a latrine.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to ride to work

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Pov, 40, has five children. Pov and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 15 years to make a living. 
Pov has been with VisionFund for two cycles and she is leading her group to seek a loan. Pov, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Prudence Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de six(06) dames travail avec ACFIME depuis juin 2013,elles sont à leur quatrième prêt et elles ont toujours rembourser à temps. Christine, présidente du groupe est une femme battante,marié et mère de deux enfants. Elle est restauratrice et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce dans ce domaine. Avec son activité, elle arrive à rémunérer ses deux employés et à contribuer pour les dépenses de la maison. Avec ce prêt, Christine va diversifier son menu et proposer des plats de qualité à ses clients et les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux prendre soins de sa famille et continuer ses activités.
texts.en: This group of six women work have been working with ACFIME since June 2013 and are on their fourth loan; they have always repaid their loans on time. Christine, the president of the group, is a fighting woman, who is married and mother to two children. She has a restauration activity and has been working in this field for the past ten years. Thanks to her business, she manages to pay her two employees and contribute to the household expenses. With this loan, Christine is going to diversify her menu and offer quality meals to her customers; the profits will enable her to take better care of her family and continue her business.

loans.use: to expand her menu for customers.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es del Chaco, es empleada doméstica, comenta que está estudiando para poder superarse y ser alguien en la vida.
Está siguiendo la carrera de enfermería, ella se está esforzando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Uno de sus Objetivos es de llegar a Culminar sus Estudios para así llegar a tener más ingreso y un trabajo seguro y así también llegar a cumplir con sus metas que es llegar a ampliar y culminar su humilde hogar en la que actualmente está viviendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa manera estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en: Liz, who is from El Chaco, is a housekeeper. She says that she is studying to better herself and make something of herself. She is currently studying nursing and is striving to improve her own and her family's living conditions. One of her goals is to complete her studies so she can boost her income and have a secure job.  This will also enable her to fulfil her ambitions of extending and completing the modest home in which she currently lives. She is seeking this loan to pay her bills, which will allow her to get steadily closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una joven sacrificada que busca el crecimiento del nivel de vida mediante el estudio.
Para ella es de suma importancia contar con su título y ejercer su profesión.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de esa profesión quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de título, ya que así podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Norma is a selfless young woman who wants to improve her standard of living through studying. For her it is vital to gain her qualification and work in her chosen profession. She is studying business administration and, through this profession, she wants to get on in life and improve her living conditions. She is seeking this loan to pay her tuition fees as this will cover her expenses.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, invirtió el financiamiento anterior en materiales importantes para elaborar las diferentes prendas de vestir que sus clientes le encargan, su negocio es más popular, con las nuevas ganancias ha cancelado sus deudas, las circunstancias familiares son mejores y ha logrado establecer una pequeña ganadería para tener ingresos extras.
Se decidió por un nuevo préstamo que en esta ocasión lo invertirá en remodelar un nuevo local para la sastrería y en comprar concentrado para alimentar su ganado, equipara mejorar la sastrería para seguir dando buena atención a sus clientes y cuidara de su ganado de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Juan used the previous loan to buy the materials he needed to make different garments that his customers ordered. His business has become more popular and he has paid off all his debts with the profits he made. His family’s living conditions have improved and he was able to buy some cattle in order to receive an extra income.

Juan decided to request a new loan. This time, he will use it to renovate the new place where he will have his tailor shop and to buy feed for his cattle. He will improve his shop to continue offering a good service and will take care of his cattle in the best way possible.

loans.use: to renovate a place for his tailor shop and to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Manuel de 42 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos, 1 hija de 17 años de edad y un hijo de 13 años,  son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad.

La actividad que le realiza es la compra y venta de almaciga de café injertada  el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de café y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de dos cuerdas de terrenos. Una de las metas de don Manuel es incrementar su producto de café y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de café.
texts.en: The earth has been blessed by hands which like to work and tend it. It is an admirable that people devote themselves to this work for years and for their whole lives. Without the hard work of the country dwellers who are so dedicated to tending it, the land would not give us the produce which sustains generation after generation.  One of these men is 42-year-old Manuel who has 2 children - a girl of 17 and a boy of 13, both of whom are outstanding students at the local school. His business involves buying and selling grafted coffee plants. He chose this business because he has land and a suitable climate for growing coffee and it earns him a good income. He also has a second job as a day labourer, as he is always looking to help his neighbours in the village. He will use the loan to buy two plots of land.  One of Manuel's goals is to boost his coffee production and improve his methods for growing coffee.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Maria Ester
