texts.es:
María, vive con su compañero de vida e hijos, son dependientes de ella y su compañero de vida, no cuentan con más ingresos que los que generan cultivando granos básicos; desde hace 15 años práctica la  agricultura, lo hace en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, sus conocimientos se los heredo su padre. El riesgo  en este negocio es cambio del clima.
Comprará insumos agrícolas con los que pueda preparar el terreno para sembrar granos básicos, tales como: insecticidas, abono, semilla y herbicidas, así estará preparado para para cuidar sus cultivos de alguna posible plaga, espera tener una cosecha abundante, aumento en sus ventas y ganancias.
Sus proyectos son obtener mejores ganancias para brindar a su familia oportunidades de un buen desarrollo y resarcir la deuda.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her spouse and children, who currently depend on her and her spouse. They do not earn any income, besides that which is generated from growing basic grains. They have been practicing agriculture for 15 years, working from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon--her knowledge about agriculture was inherited from her father. Climate change is a risk in doing this kind of business.

She will buy agricultural supplies, such as insecticides, fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides, in order to prepare the soil to plant grains and rid their crops from any possible pest. She hopes to have an abundant harvest, which will improve her sales and profit.

Her hopes are to obtain high profits in order to better her family's development opportunities, as well as to repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to prepare the soil to plant grains

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, comenta que el financiamiento anterior lo invirtió en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, teniendo como resultado una cosecha abundante y libre de plagas. La rentabilidad de su negocio ha aumentado. Nuevamente es madre de una niña, a pesar de que su familia ha aumentado Ernestina manifiesta que cuenta con la posibilidad de cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
Se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar harina, maíz, manteca, azúcar, etc., insumos agrícolas y concentrado para cerdos, le ayudara mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que tendrá a su disposición la materia prima para elaborar pan artesanal, podrá cultivar maíz y alimentara mejor a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Ernestina says that she invested the previous loan in her corn and beans plantations. As a result, she had an abundant harvest free from plagues. Her business has become more profitable. She gave birth to another girl, and despite the fact that her family has grown, Ernestina says that she is capable of providing for them.

She decided to request a new loan to buy flour, corn, butter, sugar, etc. She will also buy agricultural supplies and feed for her pigs. This will help her to improve her business, since she will have all the ingredients she needs to prepare artisanal bread, and she will be able to grow corn and feed her pigs better.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, butter and sugar, agricultural supplies and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Francisca  de 29 años de edad soltera a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de abarrotería, ella tiene la visión de superar cada día en su negocio para que le genere más ganancias para el beneficio de su familia. 

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de abarrotería en la comunidad, ella  tomo esa iniciativa de vender productos de abarrotería porque ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en dicho campo laboral y sabe que deja muy buena ganancia para ella y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida. 

El uso respectivo que la dará el crédito es para la compra de terreno ya que ella es una mujer con visiones hacia el futuro, piensa en el futuro de sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su comunidad. Con las ganancias que obtengan de su negocio sus metas personales en los próximos años es graduarse como medico profesional e instalar una farmacia en su comunidad para servir a la gente que necesitan de un servicio médico.
texts.en:
The need to get ahead in life motivated Francisca, 29, to learn different activities. For years, she has worked selling groceries. Her vision is to improve her business every day in order to receive better profits for her family’s sake.

She buys and sells groceries locally. She decided to work with this because she has a ten-year experience in this field and knows that it is a profitable business. This can help her and her family to improve their living conditions.

She will use the loan to buy a piece of land. She is a visionary woman who wants a good future for her children and her community. She plans to use the profits to become a doctor and open a pharmacy to help those who need medical attention.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, bricks and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, wardrobes, etc. to fulfill orders she currently has

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Эту 40-летнюю женщину на фотографии зовут Мухаббат. Она уроженка горного района Хуросон, где основным занятием населения являются растениеводство и животноводство. И Мухаббат не исключение. Она на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством. Муж находится на заработках в России и Мухаббат живет в районе с четырьмя сыновьями, которым с 8 по 15 лет. Все ее сыновья помогают ей в разведении скотов. Сейчас Мухаббат хотела бы увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе и для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, так как у нее нет сбережений. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: The woman in this photograph is 40 years old and her name is Muhabbat.  She is a native of the mountainous region of Khuroson, where most of the people are engaged in either agriculture or raising livestock.  Muhabbat is no exception - she has been raising livestock for five years.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and Muhabbat lives in her native region with their four sons, who range in age from 8 to 15.  All of her sons help her raise her livestock.  Now she wants to increase her head of cattle on her farm and she needs a loan to do this, as she does not have enough saved up.  She is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Johnrey

texts.en:
Johnrey is single and lives with his family.  He provides transportation services in their village to make a living.

For more than a year, he has earned well to support the family.  He needs to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle to be used for transportation to improve the services to his customers. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized.

In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle unit and use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to buy sidecar for his motorcycle to be used for the service

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diện works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Diện is 25 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Diện's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diện has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Diện faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Diện hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman and she has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to own a big supermarket within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Этот 31-летний выходец из района А.Джоми является певцом. Его зовут Тохир. У него с детства проявлялся талант пения, но он начал свою профессиональную  творческую деятельность лишь 7 лет назад. Тохиру этот талант передан от отца, который тоже был в свое время знаменитым певцом.
Тохир предоставляет свои услуги на свадьбах и других торжественных мероприятиях. У него прекрасный голос и поэтому у него всегда достаточно заказов. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент музыкальных инструментов и расширить свою деятельность. Однако такие инструменты стоят дорого, поэтому Тохир обратился за кредитом. Для реализации цели ему не хватает 3000 долларов США. Он очень надеется получить финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: This man is 31 years old and he is a singer from the A. Jomi region.  His name is Tohir and he has had a talent for singing since childhood, but he only started singing professionally seven years ago.  He received this talent from his father, who was also a talented singer in his time.  Tohir works at weddings and other special occasions.  He has a wonderful voice and he always has enough work.  He wants to increase his assortment of musical instruments and expand his business, but these instruments are expensive, which is why Tohir needs a loan.  To realize this goal, he needs $3,000 USD.  He is greatly hoping to receive financial support.

loans.use: to buy the necessary musical instruments to expand his business.

loans.name: Kha

texts.en:
Kha is 44 years old and a married man who has two dependent children and two married children. He lives in a rural area of Prey Veng Province.

To earn a living, he and his wife manage a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost twenty years, with the average income of 4 USD a day. 

Kha wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its equipment. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sahobat

texts.ru: Сахобат является уроженкой района Хуросон. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем, у нее трое сыновей и дочь. Мужа сейчас нет рядом, он вынужденно работает в России, так как ему надо кормить семью. Сахобат тоже трудится. Она при дворе дома разводит коров и быков, и по прошествии определенного времени продает их на скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. Данной деятельностью она занимается вместе с сыновьями  на протяжении 3 лет. В ее хозяйстве осталась сейчас всего пару скотов и поэтому она хочет увеличить их поголовье, чтобы увеличить доход от их продаж. Для купли пару голов бычков она запрашивает кредит. Сахобат верит и ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Sahobat is a native of the Khuroson region.  She is 40 years old and she is married with three sons and one daughter.  Her husband is not nearby at the moment - he needed to find work in Russia to he could provide for his family.  Sahobat also works.  She raises cattle at their home and sells them on after a period of time at the local animal market.  She and her sons have been engaged in this line of work for three years.  She already has two cows on her farm and she wants to increase her head of livestock so as to increase their income.  She needs a loan to buy two bulls.  Sahobat is relying on and awaiting support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of bulls to raise and resell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman and she has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, flour, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to own a big supermarket within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: An Ka Bin Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les membres du groupe AN KA BIN ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, .pommes de terres, légumes, habits et jarres. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1iercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kiatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de .pommes de terre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs  de .pommes de terres en gros au marché Médine de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kiatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the 'An Ka Bin' Group are mostly married and live in polygamous households.  They are, on average, 34 years old and have four children.  The women all live in Kanadjiguila and know one another through neighbourhood ties and their work at the Kanadjiguila market.  They sell potatoes, vegetables, clothes and jars.

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Kiatou (standing on the far left in the photo) is a successful potato seller.  She plans to use her loan to buy 15 sacks of potatoes wholesale from the Médine Market in Bamako.  She will then retail them at the market in Kanadjiguila to mostly women.

Kiatou expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and meet some of the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de huit (8) femmes, les membres du groupe Benkan sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente du miel, condiments et habits. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1èr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse du miel. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 80 litres du miel. Elles s’approvisionnent en miel dans les villages environnants de Bamako.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Kadiatou compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The eight members of the 'Benkan' Group are all married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 39 years old and have six children.  The women all live in Daoudabougou, a district of Bamako, and know one another through neighbourhood and family ties, and their work.  They sell honey, food ingredients and clothes.

In order to increase their stocks of product, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Kadiatou (standing on the far right in the photo) is a successful honey seller.  She plans to use her loan to buy 80 litres of honey from the villages surrounding Bamako.  She will then retail it on foot, for cash or on credit.  Sometimes she takes orders.  Her customers are both men and women.

Kadiatou expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for the healthcare costs of her children.  Her long term objective is to use this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy honey for resale.

loans.name: Grupo Palilic Group

texts.es:
Las calles de Suchitepéquez es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. Es la actividad que doña Maria de 35 años de edad con cuatro hijos que sustentar uno de sus hijos ya tiene familia propia y los otros 3 hijos de ella son buenos estudiantes de la comunidad. (Maria es la 1ra de izquierda a derecha)

La actividad que ella realiza con todo esmero cada día es la venta de ropa típica ya que es un buen negocio, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad por 7 años de vender ropa y la venta lo realiza en su aldea y demás vecinos por los alrededores es un buen negocio y le deja buenas ganancias para ella para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Maria se ha convertido en un claro ejemplo para poder súper en la vida y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha juntado a ella para emprender sus sueños de superación en la vida.

El uso que le dará al préstamo solicitado es para la compra de más mercadería de ropa típica para obtener más ingresos económicos. Su meta al futuro es tener un local en el centro de su comunidad y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuado para poder despertar ese deseo de estudiar y llegar a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The streets of Suchitepéquez are a witness to the vibrant colors of the traditional blouses and sashes. It is impossible for any tourist not to admire these products, to stop and purchase some.  This is Maria's business.  She is 35 years old, with four children to support; one of her children has his own family and the other three are good students in the community. (Maria is the first from the left to right.)

The work she does with such care every day is selling traditional clothing since it is a good business.  She as done this work of selling clothing for 7 years, and she sells it in her town and other neighborhoods nearby. It is a good business and it provides her with good profits so she can improve her family's living conditions.  

By her life, Maria has become a clear example of being able to improve oneself, and it is for that reason that a group of women have joined with her to work on their dreams of improving their lives.

The use that she will give the requested loan is to purchase more merchandise of traditional clothing to have more economic income.  Her goal in the future is to have a retail space in the center of her community and to build houses for her children so that they have adequate living conditions to be able to awaken the desire to study and become professionals in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Danaya est constitué de six (6) femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de tubercules, sacs, savons, œufs, et poisson.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des tubercules à Kalaban-coro. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coro au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sali  compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The six members of the 'Danaya' Group are all married and live in polygamous households.  They are, on average, 38 years old and have three children.  The women all live in Kalaban-coro, a district of Bamako, and know one another through savings groups in their neighbourhood and their work.  They sell tubers, bags, soap, eggs and fish.

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Sali (sitting second from the left in the photo) is a successful tuber seller in Kalaban-coro.  She plans to use her loan to buy 5 sacks of potatoes from Médine.  She will then retail them for cash in Kalaban-coro to mostly women.

Sali expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and meet some of the needs of her children.  In the long-term she is relying on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her aim of enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy tubers for resale.

loans.name: An Ka Dieya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 5 femmes, les membres du groupe AN KA DIEYA sont majoritairement  mariées et vivent dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Ouolofobougou de la commune III du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’oignons, d’atieké, de poisson frais et charbon  il y a plus de 10 ans. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso    et  sont  à leur  premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Ahissa (la 1ère  femme à l’extrême gauche) a une bonne notoriété, car  l’oignons et un légume très prises par les femmes dans le marché de Ouolofobougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’oignons et 10 sacs de charbon de bois. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Médine  et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Ouolofobougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en: The An Ka Dieya Group consists of five women who are mostly married and live in polygamous households.  They have an average age of 32 and two children.  They all live in the Ouolofobougou neighborhood in the Third commune of Bamako, the capital of Mali.  They met through their neighborhood savings groups and their income-generating activities.  The group members have been engaging in different income-generating activities, including the sale of onions, atikeke, fresh fish, and charcoal, for over 10 years. To expand and grow their businesses, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.  Ms. Ahissa (at the far left of the photo) enjoys a good reputation because onion is a very popular vegetable among women in the Ouolofobougou market. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of onions and 10 bags of charcoal.  She buys her supplies at the main market in Medine and at the weekly village fairs.  She sells for credit to a clientele of women in Ouolofobougou. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA that will be used to meet her needs and reinvested in her business. Her goal is to maintain a loyal partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to benefit from many loans.

loans.use: to buy onions and charcoal.

loans.name: Grupo La Gran Familia Group

texts.es:
En el departamento de Suchitepéquez, durante 4 años, Dalia, mujer soltera de 43 años, se ha dedicado elaboración de cortes. Como mujer trabajadora, ha tomado el reto de la vida de sacar adelante sus tres hijos que se han convertido en el motivo de luchar cada día para tener un mejor futuro para su familia y que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada. (Dalia es la que se encuentra de  1ra de derecha a izquierda de blusa de color besh) 

Su actividad principal es la venta de cortes, dicha actividad lo ha venido realizando desde hace 4 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de comida por los alrededores de su comunidad, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora siempre busca nuevas estrategias para poder tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia para que tengan la condición de vida que se merecen.

Ella ha sido una gran líder en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de personas de han unido a ella para emprender los negocios para el éxito del mañana.

El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo es para la compra de mercadería que ella utiliza para la elaboración de cortes, uno de los sueños de Dalia es la construcción de casa para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y mejorar sus ventas con el requerimiento de un préstamo.
texts.en:
In Suchitepéquez department for the past 4 years, Dalia, a single 43-year-old woman, has worked making cortes (traditional woven Guatemalan skirts). As a hard-working woman, she has taken on life's challenge to get her three children ahead, which has become her motivation to fight every day to have a better future for her family and that they have adequate living conditions. (Dalia is the first from the right to the left, wearing a beige shirt.)

Her primary work is selling cortes, she has done this work for the past 4 years, and the secondary job that she does is sell food around her community. She is a very enterprising woman who always seeks new strategies to be able to have an income for the benefit of her family and so they have the living conditions they deserve. 

She has been a great leader in her community and, for this reason, a group of people have joined her to undertake businesses for future success.   

The respective use that she will give the loan is to purchase merchandise that she will use to make cortes.  One of Dalia's dreams is to build a house for her children so they have adequate living conditions and to improve her sales with the request of a loan.

loans.use: to purchase material to make traditional woven Guatemalan skirts (cortes)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and other groceries

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Djiguiya  est constitué de six femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente d’habits (friperies), légumes, condiments et poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïssata (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits et légumes dans le marché d’Ouolofobougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’oignons, 1 panier de tomate, 1 panier de choux. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Kati  et au grand marché. La revente s’effectue au marché au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata  compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The six members of the 'Djiguiya' Group are all married women who live in polygamous households.  They are, on average, 38 years old and have four children.  The women all live in Daoudabougou, a distict of Bamako, and know one another through neighbourhood savings groups and their work.  They sell vegetables, clothing, food ingredients and fish.

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Aïssata (sitting on the far left in the photo) is a successful fruit and vegetable seller at the Ouolofobougou Market.  She plans to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of onions, a basket of tomatoes and a basket of cabbages from the main market and in Kati.  She will then retail them for cash, at the market, mostly to women.

Aïssata expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and meet some of the needs of her children.  She is relying on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her goal of enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Al llegar a casa de Martha, de 59 años, el primer olor que se siente es el de las tortillas recién hechas y listas para vender por las mañanas. No obstante, cuando se avanza al patio, el olor cambia pues no posee las tuberías de las aguas negras. Martha es reconocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, quien siempre trabajó en una tabacalera para sustentar a sus tres hijos que ahora tienen 21, 23 y 24 años de edad, pero que hace más de un año tuvo que renunciar debida al daño que le provocaba en su salud. Al salir no dudó ni un segundo para vender tortillas, elotes y güirilas, trabajo que no solo lo vio como una forma de ingresos, sino como una manera de entretenerse también. 
Esta madre soltera solo llegó a cuarto grado de primaria debido a problemas económicos, pero no dejó de luchar por salir adelante. En estos momentos no tiene otros ingresos, pero cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Durante 15 años Martha ha vivido en la misma casa y no ha podido tener la oportunidad de tener la conexión de aguas negras como debe ser, por lo que ahora se encuentra feliz al solicitar un préstamo para pagar los derechos de la conexión de este servicio y así poder avanzar con unas de sus metas que le permitirán tener una vivienda más higiénica. Su próxima meta es construir el servicio higiénico completo.
texts.en:
Upon arriving at 59-year-old Martha's house, the first smell one notices is the recently-made tortillas which are ready to sell in the mornings. However, when one approaches the patio, the smell changes because she doesn't have a sewer connection. Martha is recognized as a hard-working woman who always has worked in a cigarette factory to sustain her three children who are now 21, 23, and 24 years old. But, over a year ago, she had to resign from her work due to the damage that it has caused to her health. Upon leaving, she didn't wait even a second to start selling tortillas, corn, and güirilas (thick, sweet tortillas), work that she saw not only as a means of income, but also as a way to entertain herself. 

She is a single mother who only studied up to the fourth grade due to economic reasons, but she never stopped fighting to get ahead. At this time, she doesn't have other income, but she has the help of her children. For 15 years, Martha has lived in the same house and has not had the opportunity to have a sewer connection, for which reason she is now happy to ask for a loan to pay for the connection of this service and be able to advance with one of her goals which will allow her to have a more hygienic home. Her next goal is to build a complete bathroom.

loans.use: to pay for a sewer connection.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq (5) femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des chaussures en plastic, du fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1èr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Kankou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente de condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomates. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à  Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Kankou compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en: The Benkadi Group consists of five women who are mostly married and live in polygamous households. They have an average age of 40 and five children. They all live in Daoudabougou one of the neighborhood in Bamako. They met through family and neighborhood ties and their income-generating businesses. The group members sell plastic shoes, precooked fonio, and millet flour. To restock their inventory for sale, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Ms. Kankou (sitting at the far left of the photo) enjoys a good reputation for the sale of tomatoes. She plans to use her loan to buy four bins of tomatoes. She buys her supplies in Medine and resells for cash and credit as a traveling saleswoman and sometimes by preorder to a clientele of mostly women. Ms. Kankou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA that will be used to pay for the education and healthcare of her children.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Hello! Meet Emmy, a 40-year-old mother of three children (one girl and two boys). She is very hardworking, honest and ever-smiling. She hails from the remote village of Kaplong in Litein area of Kenya, a very rich, fertile place. Emmy has been single-handedly taking care of her children through practicing mixed farming for the past seven years. Her primary sources of income are milk and a small personal business that she does in order to make ends meet. Emmy plans to start poultry farming on her expansive land, but one challenge she is facing is insufficient funds. Poultry farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and can be done on a part-time basis as you do other farming activities. She always says that, “to be a good poultry farmer you need to know the different breeds of chicken, chicken feeds and how to prevent disease.” Emmy is confident that through the loan she will be able to sell her poultry to the ready market that is there. She believes that through poultry farming her life will permanently change because poultry farming has so many advantages. You can sell eggs, poultry meat, and poultry feathers. Marketing of poultry products will never be a problem for Emmy because the demand for chicken is always high. It is a popular meal for many people, which is proven by visiting any fast food restaurant. Emmy feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that assist aspiring women in achieving their dreams. Emmy chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on the loan is low and is on a reducing basis. She completed training through Juhudi Kilimo. During the training session, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Profits from the business will be used to fully repay the loan, to improve her living conditions, and to assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Nienta sont uniquement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coro l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’habits, du poisson frais et encensoirs. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Sokona Diamou(femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  le pagne wax est très prisé par les femmes à Kalaban-coro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Kalaban-coro à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The four members of the 'Nienta' Group are all married women who live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 34 years old and have three children.  The women all live in Kalaban-coro, a distict of Bamako, and know one another through neighbourhood savings groups and their work.  They sell clothing, fresh fish and incense urns.

In order to expand their businesses, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Sokona Diamou (sitting second from the left in the photo) is well-known for selling highly sought after wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in Kalaban-coro.  She plans to use her loan to buy 60 wax pagnes from Bamako.  She will then retail them for cash, to women in Kalaban-coro

Sokona Diamou expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and meet some of her needs.  She wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to use further loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Umedakhon

texts.ru: Умедахон добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Ей уже за сорок. Она работает медсестрой в операционной госпиталя. Ее муж простой водитель. Они ведут скромную жизнь в своем районе Шахритус. Чтобы улучшить финансовые условия семьи, Умедахон планирует параллельно начать новый бизнес. Ее интересует откорм и продажа скота. У нее есть все условия для ведения данного бизнеса. Ей только не хватает финансовых средств, чтобы купить скот. Поэтому Умедахон обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму кредита собирается приобрести двух голов бычков хорошей породы и начать свой бизнес. Она нуждается в данном кредите.
texts.en: Umedakhon is a kind and sympathetic woman.  She is already over 40 and she works as a nurse in the surgical hospital.  Her husband is a simple driver and the live a modest life in their region of Shahrituz.  In order to improve their financial circumstances, Umedakhon plans on starting a new side business raising and selling livestock.  She has everything she needs to start this business except the financial means to buy the cattle.  For this reason, Umedakhon has asked for a loan, with which she will buy two bulls from a good breeder to start her business.  She is in need of this loan.

loans.use: to buy two well-bred bulls to start her new livestock business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Benkadi est constitué de quatre (4) femmes  majoritairement mariées  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Adekene l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente du poisson, parures et condiments.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du poisson frais. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  90 kg du poisson. Elles s’approvisionnent  au quartier du fleuve. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban Adekene au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djénèba compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en: This Benkadi Group consists of four women who are mostly married and living in monogamous households. They have an average age of 29 and three children. They all live in Kalaban Adekene, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They met through neighborhood savings groups and their income-generating activities. The group members run businesses, including selling fish, ornaments, and condiments. To increase their working capital, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Ms. Djeneba (sitting second from left to right in the photo) enjoys a good reputation for the sale of fresh fish. She plans to use her loan to buy 90 kg of fish. She buys her supplies in the river area and resells for credit in Kalaban Adekene to a clientele of mostly women. Ms. Djeneba expects to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA that will be used to meet the needs of her children and reinvested in her business.  Ms. Djeneba is depending a lot on the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her goal of growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a single woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable weather conditions. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of maize for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for resale

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre (4) femmes, les membres du groupe Solidarité sont uniquement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Adekene l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des chaussures en plastic, du fonio précuit et de la farine de mil. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  4ème cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires (petit poids, thés, lait en poudre, beurres et lait concentré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de petit poids, 5 cartons du thé, 3 cartons de beurres, 1 carton de lait en poudre et 2 cartons de lait concentré. Elles s’approvisionnent en produits alimentaire à Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit et parfois par commande à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Salimata compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the Solidarité Group are all married women who live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 45 years old and have five children.  The women all live in Kalaban Adekene, a distict of Bamako, and know one another through family and neighbourhood ties, and their work.  They sell plastic shoes, pre-cooked fonio and millet flour.

In order to increase their stocks, the group members work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth group loan.

Salimata (sitting second from the right in the photo) sells food products (petits pois, tea, powdered milk, butter and concentrated milk.  She plans to use her loan to buy 2 boxes of petits pois, 5 boxes of tea, 3 boxes of butter, a box of powdered milk and 2 boxes of concentrated milk from Bamako.  She will then retail them for cash or credit to a mixed customer base.  Sometimes she takes orders for her products.

Salimata expects to achieve a monthly average profit of 60,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for schooling and healthcare for her children.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jenny es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganar lo propio con su trabajo y con esto ayudarle  a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de dulces que son deliciosos y tienen mucha salida y que son muchos los comerciantes que llegan  hasta su hogar a cómprale para luego llevarlos a vender  a diferentes lugares de la provincia, así ella se gana sus propios ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito  ya que es su forma de salir adelante y con esto poder comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para sus hijos, con sus ganancias compro cosas que necesitaban sus hijos para sus estudios. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar azúcar, harina y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los dulces. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierra Amarillas in the Rocafuerte canton, the members of the "Mejorando El Futuro" loan group meets every fortnight. This area of Ecuador is known for its farming work, as many here work growing short cycle crops.

And it is here that 26-year-old Jenny lives. She is married and has two children who are eleven and six years old respectively. They attend the local school while Jenny's husband is a businessman.

Jenny is a very plucky woman who likes to earn her own living through her work, and to use it to help her husband with household costs. Jenny works producing and selling delicious sweets. The sweets sell well as many shop-owners come to her home to buy the sweets to take away and sell in different parts of the province. With this work, Jenny earns her own income to help her children to get ahead in life.

Jenny is taking out another loan as it will help her to make a profit and, with these profits, she can buy necessary items for her children. Jenny has used her profits before to buy necessary items for her children's education. Jenny will use this loan to buy sugar, flour and other items for preparing sweets. Jenny has been with the loan group since its creation and she likes it because of the benefits of working with the organisation. Jenny's dreams are to give her children the best life possible.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other items for preparing sweets.

loans.name: Gilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Gilma, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Gilma realiza el crédito para su esposo el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra arroz y verduras en toda época del año ya que cuenta terrenos con riego, son tres cosechas de estos productos que realiza al año y de esta forma ellos logran salir adelante, con su marido trabajan dos o tres personas a quienes les paga por su trabajo lo cual los convierte en fuente de ingresos para estas familias. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito  ya que actualmente necesitan sembrar unas parcelas nuevas, como siempre los que le quedan de ingresos ellos los vuelven a invertir en sus cultivos y para la alimentación y sustento diario de su familia. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar arroz y verduras. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierras Amarillas in the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the credit group Mejorando El Futuro [Improving the Future] meet every fifteen days. This area is known for its agriculture since most of the inhabitants are involved in farming short-cycle crops. 
Here lives Gilma, 54. She's married and has three grown children who are independent. Her husband works in agriculture. 
Gilma is taking a loan for her husband's work in agriculture, planting rice and vegetables all year round on irrigated land with three crop rotations. It takes a year for their crops to grow. This is the way that she and her move forward. They pay two or three people who are paid for their work which makes them a source of income for these families.
She is repeating her loan because she needs to plant some new plots. As always, her remaining income will be reinvested in their crops for the food and livelihood for their family. She will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow rice and vegetables. This is her fourth loan cycle in the credit group. Her dream is to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to grow rice and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start building a room

loans.name: Adriana Querida

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y la menor estudia en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 
Doña Adriana es una mujer muy luchadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de corviches, empanadas, totillas de yuca y de maíz, además de aguas, colas y jugos, los fines de semana también prepara deliciosos platos típicos como los  deliciosos secos y caldo de gallina criolla, platos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ya son siete años con su negocio el cual le  da lo necesario para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar maíz, yuca, maní, gallinas y otros víveres para preparar los deliciosos platos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio  y le  gusta por la ayudan que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es ver que su hija sea una muy buena profesional.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierras Amarillas in the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the credit group Mejorando El Futuro [Improving the Future] meet every fifteen days. This area is known for its agriculture since most of the inhabitants are involved in farming short-cycle crops. 
Here lives Adriana, 58. She's married and has four older children. Two of her children are still at home and the youngest is in high school. Her husband works in agriculture. 
Adriana is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn on her own so she helps her husband with the household expenses. She makes and sells corviche [mashed green plantains stuffed with tuna and fried], empanadas, tortillas made of yucca and corn, plus water, sodas, and juices. On the weekends she also prepares delicious dishes like the famous Creole chicken dishes that her are in-demand from her customers. She has had this business for seven years. She needs to succeed because her husband does not earn much in his work in agriculture. 
This loan will be used to buy corn, yucca, peanuts, chickens, and other ingredients to prepare delicious dishes. She has been in this credit group from the beginning and likes the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to see that her daughter is a good professional.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making traditional Ecuadorian dishes

loans.name: Chanchala

texts.en:
Chanchala is only 24 years old and is a hardworking and thriving woman. She is from the remote village of Vivekananda Pally in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and blessed with two little kids. She has a primary education.

For the past several years, she has worked in the field of sewing, a skill that she learned empirically by observation, and that little by little she has been perfecting, expanding her knowledge through practice. She takes orders from her neighbors and stitches varieties of garments like shirts, pants, petticoats, salwar, etc. Her husband, Harogobindo, is also engaged in this business.

She is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to strengthen her work, since with the money she will buy a specialized sewing machine which will make her work more rapid, and facilitate production and the acquisition of more contracts, generating more income.

Chanchala states that her greatest challenge is competition in the market. However, this keeps her motivated to offer better service and to struggle so that her dream of having an accredited business will become reality and it will generate more income. In this way, she will improve her quality of life.

She is motivated to open her own shop, for which she prepared a space in her home and hopes it to be possible in the future.

She thanks her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her existing business.

loans.name: Om Shg Group

texts.en:
Om Self Help Group was formed in 2013 and is composed of 10 members in a small village in Odisha. Kumari is the lady who is standing with her hand raised in the photograph. Kumari, aged 40, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Om SHG. Kumari has one son, aged 15 years. She is living with her husband and her son. Her son is continuing his schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Kumari plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so, she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques. Both Kumari and her husband have been involved in this activity for 15 years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. 

Kumari currently grows rice. She has requested a loan to expand her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to enlarge the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Maa Hingulai Shg Group

texts.en:
Bimala is 27 years old and married. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Bimala. She lives in a village in the Koraput district with her husband and her two children. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she manages to earn about 5,000 INR per month. 

This is a group loan for Bimala's group of 12 women called Maa Hingulai Self Help Group. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Bimala wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to better her living conditions. The members of the Maa Hingulai Self Help Group are very ambitious and are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, retail stores, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as heavy rainfall, which affects tea. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Maa Sankalai Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012 a group of ten women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Maa Sankalai Self-Help Group. Basanti was selected as the leader of Maa Sankalai SHG. The lady standing with her raised hand is Basanti. 

Basanti is 41 years old, married, and living with her husband and two children. She has been involved in a milk business for eight years. She has one cow and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to supply the growing demand of the customers in the market. She has applied for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and also wants to repair her cattle shed. This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education and to pay her children's tuition fee.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her milk business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from Maynaguri. She is a 29-year-old lady who has two children (one son and one daughter). She lives with her children and husband in their own house in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district. She studied till grade 12. Her children go to school and read in grade 4 and grade 6.

Anita's husband is a butcher. He runs a meat shop and sells meat in the local market to cover his household expenses, but his income is too scanty to manage all the expenses of their family. So Anita has been engaged with a tailoring business for a few years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She mainly stitches ladies' garments such as frocks, blouses, petticoats, etc., and sells to the local garments shop. It is a very tedious job, but she is a woman of strong determination who believes that hard work has its own reward. She works tirelessly to grow her business and earn a good income. Now she wants to change her old sewing machine and purchase a new one.

She has now requested a loan from Kiva's partner BJS, which she intends to use to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thimbles, fabric marking pens, etc. This will help her to create a way to increase her revenue, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. Her goals are to admit her children into a renowned school to provide them a successful future.

Anita is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan and is hopeful that it will help her to secure more customers.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustful and determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as heavy rainfall, which affects growth of tea. 

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa comes from a rural area. She works every day to earn a living. Sharifa is married and has a son. 

She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 18 years. She feeds cows in her house where she has a cowshed. She has a good opportunity to develop business with animal husbandry because she lives in an agricultural region. Sharifa sells the feeding cattle in a local market. Her son and husband help her with feeding cattle. They also grow agriculture crops in 1.8 ha of land. 

She is going to increase working capital, so she needs your financial support. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Sorio

texts.en: Sorio owns and operates a farm, where he plants and harvests a variety of crops to sell in order to earn a living. He's been working on the farm for many years and it sustains his family. Sorio has successfully repaid his previous loan which he used for their farm. He plans to use the additional profits generated from the farm to buy cattle; cattle help him work the farm. Recently, he took out a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve their farm and increase his profits to support his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve their farm.

loans.name: Maa Bagabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Bhagabati Self-Help Group was formed with 12 members in 2013 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Bhagabati as the leader of their group. The lady standing with her raised hand is Bhagabati. 

Bhagabati is a 38-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children. For seven years, Bhagabati's husband has been working as a farmer to support his small family. His income is not sufficient to support the family. So, Bhagabati is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the mushroom cultivating business. She has four years of experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan to buy more mushroom seeds, straw and other raw materials, and to repair the space where her mushrooms are cultivated, so that she can add to her family’s income. Bhagabati says that by selling mushrooms, she can support her family, and she can send her children to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her children. 

The other members of the group are involved in fish selling, agriculture and retail stores.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds, straw and other raw materials, and to repair the space where her mushrooms are cultivated.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a widowed woman. She has six children. She describes herself as committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area fit for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maa Bankeswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Chandramaa, the lady standing with her raised hand in photo, is 35 years old and married. She has two children who are both in schooling. Her family lives in a village of the Koraput District in Odisha, India. 

She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 4,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs.

Chandramaa is leading a group named Maa Bankeswari Self-Help Group. Its 10 members are applying for the loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Maa Bankeswari SHG are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, general store, dairy farm, wood business. Chandramaa is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Baba Akhandalamani Shg Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a 41-year-old lady living with her husband and three children. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Basanti. 

She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells ten litres of milk per day and earns 8,000 INR per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of five persons as her children are in school. She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger.

Basanti, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two cows and renovating the cattle shed.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en: Tharcisse is aged 35 years old. He is married with three children aged between 4 and 7; one of them goes to school. He has been selling boutique items for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as soap, sugar, rice and beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soap, sugar, rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael would come home to his daughter and son after a long day. Exhausted and covered in paint, he asked himself why he did not start his own business. “I am good at what I do,” he says.  

Taking his passion and his skills, Raphael went into business for himself. Flexible hours and no middle man means Raphael can spend more time with his family and provide them with a steady source of income. 

He has the skills, but starting on his own was harder than he had originally thought. Raphael wants to make his business as successful as he can, but equipment and materials are becoming too expensive. The cost of paint, brushes, machinery, and other materials are hindering his business’ ability to thrive. Raphael will use his loan to purchase the equipment and supplies he needs to keep his business and passion alive.

loans.use: To invest in materials and equipment

loans.name: Flor Nieve

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. El marido trabaja en una institución pública en Portoviejo.
Doña Flor es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días más que todo en horas de la mañana, a ella le encanta su trabajo y  le ha ido muy bien, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierras Amarillas in the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the credit group Mejorando El Futuro (Making the Future Better) meet biweekly. This area is known for its agriculture; most of the inhabitants make their living with short-cycle crops. 
One of the town’s inhabitants, Flor, is 42 years old and is in a common law marriage, from which she has two children aged 18 and 15 who are studying in school. Her husband works in a public institution in Portoviejo. 
Flor is a housewife, and in order to make her own income and thereby help her husband with the household expenses, she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women). She works every day, mostly in the morning. She loves her job and has done very well. She sells her products on credit and collects payments once a week. She has been doing this for more than 5 years, and her best-selling products are perfumes and cosmetics. 
This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been with this credit group from the start and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
With the new methods for selling the piglets, the Wiguna Merta group earns more income then before. Some of the members are fattening pigs for sale and the others are raising sows for piglets. It's proven to be easy to sell the piglets. 

Now they are agreed to continue the loan, but not only for pigs, but for farming also. Most of them have small gardens and they want to maximize the results. With the new loan, they will purchase piglets, feed and also various kinds of seeds and fertilizer.

Ni Nengah sells her piglets and is earning a satisfactory result. Now she joins the group for a new loan and will use it to purchase piglets, chilli seeds and fertilizer. She and her husband will plant the seeds in her garden. She wants to increase their income and she dreams of having enough savings to use as capital later. As the head of the group, she asked other member to improving their savings. She hopes the group can do it. 

Ni Nengah is at left, wearing a green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chilli seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 41 years old. She lives with her pensioner mother, her sister and her brother-in-law in the small village called Daba Kulashi. 

Shorena is experienced in the clothes trading business and she needs some money to continue trading. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $550 for business. She will have a chance to generate more income and will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. Shorena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie, age 54 years old, is married with 5 children, ages between 10 and 33; all of them go to school. Marie has been selling foodstuffs for 25 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more food such as rice, beans, and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy more food such as rice, beans, and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48-year-old, hardworking man married to Josephine who supports their family by adding an additional income. They are taking care of two children.  Joseph has been running a dairy farming business for three years, earning an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Joseph was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of 50,000 KES and intends to use this amount to buy an additional cow. Joseph plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful dairy farm man.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Carren who is a wife, a mother of 3 children, farmer and a member of Kalong Vision self-help group in the Litein area of Kenya. She is very active in running her farm as well as the day-to-day activities of the group. She has 8 years of experience in farming and over the years she has enjoyed dairy farming the most because of the regular income generated. Litein area is a very remote area and Carren has been facing challenges transporting her farm produce to the market because of poor feeder roads. Milk and vegetables are perishable products and require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and because Carren has been lacking a good transportation system, she has been facing losses. Carren is seeking funds to buy a motorbike to transport her farm produce to the market.

Juhudi Kilimo is a micro finance field partner that works with partners such as Kiva to afford marginal farmers access financial services that they otherwise cannot get because of the loan requirement. Through the loan Carren will be able to timely deliver her products to the market and she will never suffer losses from her milk going bad or vegetables not being fresh. Timely delivery of products will increase her earnings and therefore permanently change her life. When Carren was asked how this loan will benefit her family she replied, “My family’s basic needs will easily be taken care of."

Carren plans to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and assisting him in transporting the products to the market and hence she will have impacted the society positively through creation of employment. She has been trained by Juhudi Kilimo and is financially disciplined. She believes that she will repay fully back the loan and open other business ventures.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport goods to market

loans.name: Thamarai Shg - Lalgudi Group

texts.en:
Tamarai Self Help Group consists of five members from Lalgudi village, Trichy district. It is managed by a local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Chitra is group leader of the group. She lives in her own house with two children and her husband. Her husband is a farmer.

Chitra needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove that is manufactured by the Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, ltd. Traditional stoves have a high tendency to cause respiratory problems in many households as they emit carbon dioxide. The smokeless stove reduces the risk of respiratory diseases, emits less smoke and provides healthier living conditions.

Along with the Chitra, the other four members of the group are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anbumalar Shg-Poonthottam Group

texts.en:
Shoba (hand raised) is the leader of the Anbumalar Self Help group, which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group contains seven other members from the Poonthottam village of Tanjore District in Tamil Nadu. 

Shoba is 34 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer by profession, and they have a child.

The group has been receiving micro-finance loans from PAT for the last three years. These loans have been instrumental in developing the quality of their livelihood as well as in purchasing cows, goats, etc. Due to these loans, they have been able to earn more income and are prompt in their repayments.

All the members are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove that lowers firewood consumption. As a result, these stoves reduce carbon emissions as well as indoor air pollution levels. This will help these women reduce fuel consumption, lower costs and also help them create a better environment in their surrounding village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Elizer

texts.en: For a living, Elizer owns and operates a motorcycle service for the local community. He has been doing this for years. His previous loan, used for buying new tires, was repaid successfully. He plans to acquire another motorcycle unit for expansion of his business for he wants to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. Recently, Elizer took a new loan to cover motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: María Zenaida

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 15 y 11 años,  dos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta ya que con lo que hace su marido en el campo no alcanza para darles una vida digna a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de salchichas y caldo de salchichas que son degustado por sus clientes, también  vende aguas colas y jugos, ella todos los días instala su local al pie de la carretera que une a Portoviejo con muchas ciudades tanto de la costa como de la sierra por lo cual es el sitio ideal donde muchos turistas paran a probar este plato muy típico y delicioso de la localidad, lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta para el bienestar de su familia.
