Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar salchichas y otros víveres para preparar los deliciosos platos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le  gusta por la ayudan que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In a place called Tierras Amarillas in Rocafuerte Canton the members of the “Mejorando El Futuro” communal bank meet every fortnight. This area is known for it's agriculture as most of the inhabitants grow short cycle crops.

María lives here. She is 47 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has four children aged 19, 16, 15 and 11 years old. Two of them study in Secondary school and one is in Primary school. Her husband is a farmer.

María is a tenacious woman who in order to make money on her own sells sausages and sausage soup as what her husband earns in the fields is not enough to provide a dignified life for their children. She also sells water, soft drinks and juices. Every day she sets up in her stall at the foot of the road that joins Portoviejo to other cities both on the coast and in the mountains, It is the ideal place as many tourists stop to taste this typical and delicious regional dish. She has been doing this for more than 15 years through which she makes some money for the well-being of her family.

She will use the loan to buy sausages and other foods to prepare her delicious meals. She has been in the communal bank for 4 cycles and she likes it for the support the loans provide. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy sausages and other foods.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells soaps and detergents. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of soap and detergents. She hopes that in the future, she will grow financially and socially. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of soap and detergents

loans.name: Sonia Lucia |

texts.es:
Sonia, a sus 54 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hogar. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, comenzó con un negocio de venta de mercancía como útiles escolares, productos de belleza, algunos electrodomésticos, entre otros en un almacén que arrendo; los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector sonde trabaja. 

Es un negocio muy particular ya que no hay otro negocio igual a este en esa zona.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía como útiles escolares, productos de belleza, electrodomésticos, etc. así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada escolar, adicionalmente comprara una vitrina nueva para exhibir su mercancía y atraer así a nuevos clientes; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Sonia manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de este tipo de mercancías y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, at 54 years of age, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman. 

Being the mother of two was her main reason to fight relentlessly each day, looking for ways to earn a living and to bring food home. 

About 15 years ago, she began business selling merchandise including school supplies, beauty products, and some appliances, all from a store she rented. The products she sells are of very high quality, which allowed her to become known in the sector where she works. 

It is a very unique business as there is no other one like it in the area. 

This compels her to apply for a loan and build up her inventory. She will buy merchandise including school supplies, beauty products, home appliances, etc. so she can meet the rising demand of the school season, and additionally buy a display to showcase her wares and attract new customers; this will help to improve the earnings from her labor. 

Sonia says that her age does not stop her from doing what she is passionate about. Accordingly, she always sets goals, among them one of becoming a main distributor of such goods and to generate employment opportunities, and this way improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase assorted merchandise as varied as school supplies, beauty products, appliances, andothers to stock her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be hardworking and promising. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for seven years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to own a bakery within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Amar Group

texts.en:
Chadia is the featured borrower of Amar Group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their family's lives.

Chadia is a 31-year-old married mother of three. She has worked in bead work from her house for two years to help her husband in increasing their family's income and developing their lives.

Chadia is well known in her region with the special talents she has in her domain. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special released beads to improve her production, and to develop her business in a well managed way.

Chadia is the lady at the center of the picture with the dark purple top. As for the other group members, Wafaa is the first from the left with a scarf covering her head; Roueida is the second from the left with a beige top; and Rajaa is the first from the right, while Manal is the second from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special released beads to improve her production

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 60 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive con sus hijos en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como ser el maíz, y frijoles. Ella compra por quintales y revende al menudeo, este negocio lo tiene en su casa.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa.  Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener esta fuente de ingresos, actualmente solicita otro por 5,000 Lempiras para la compra de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles para reventa y seguir manteniendo su clientela y ganancias para que  su negocio crezca.
texts.en: María is 60 years old, a single mother of 4 children. She lives with her children in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. For twelve years she has been selling basic grains such as corn and beans. She buys by the quintal and resells retail. Her business is in her home. Before she used to sell clothing. She has had various loans to maintain this source of income. Currently she is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL to buy basic grains like corn and beans to resell and continue to keep her clientele and revenues so that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to resell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth works as a housekeeper, while her husband operates their transportation services business in order to make a living. She also has a backyard garden and raises pigs to help supplement the family's income. Joining GDMPC has been a big help for her in improving their standard of living. She took out a new loan to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, she plans to improve their farm, where the family gets their main source of income.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to prepare her meals and tortillas.

loans.name: Jeanne Marie

texts.en: Jeanne Marie, 30 years old, is married and has three children. Her children range in age from 2 weeks to 4 years old; two of them attend school. She has been selling clothes for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Moeuk

texts.en:
Moeuk is 43 years old and a married woman with six unmarried children. She lives in a small village of Pursat province, Cambodia. In the last ten years, she and her husband have managed a rice farming business, which is the sole source of their income. They grow rice and sell the crop to the local dealers. The farmland was located just behind their house, and the net profit that this couple can make is USD 7 a day.

Moeuk wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: Felicidad tiene un hijo, vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de supropiedad y tiene todos los servicios basicos, incluido gas domiciliario Felicidad se dedica a la venta de comida y necesita un prestamo para compra de víveres en mayor cantidad (arroz, papa, fideo, carne) Felicidad es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Felicidad has a son. She lives in a brick and concrete house on her own property in la Paz which has the basic services including natural gas. Felicidad works selling meals and needs a loan to buy food in large quantities (rice, potatoes, noodles, meat). Felicidad is the only source of income in her household so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy food in large quantities (rice, potatoes, noodles, meat)

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda helps her husband operate thier farm, where they grow and harvest bananas, coconuts and vegetables. Her husband works as a security guard and they both earn a good income to provide for their family.  

Alda wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future. Her previous loan was used for farming and was successfully repaid. To improve her farm, Alda took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizers. Alda wants to improve the entire family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is a married woman. She describes herself to be active. She operates a retail business where she sells furniture. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of furniture to sell. 

Her business goal is to have a bigger furniture store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of furniture

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en: Cyprien, who is 25 years old, has been selling mobile phone accessories for two years. With the loan, he will buy more phone accessories so he can sell them. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 46 years old and is married. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband are running a beauty salon. They started this business 10 years ago. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of hair care products to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy hair care products to sell at her beauty salon.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 41 years old and is married with 7 children, all of whom go to school. 

She works in a shop and has been running the business for 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items like soda, beer, saucepans and flasks for sale .  The profits from the business help her to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, flasks, and saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two daughters and her husband. 

Mai and her husband earn money through their business selling food. 


Lan would like to get a loan to buy food to sell from her food shop. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy food to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticrético pero al menos tiene todos los servicios básicos Maria elabora y vende papas fritas Maria pide un credito para comprar papas al por mayor para procesarlas El esposo de Maria es un esmerado taxista pero lo que gana no alcanza para ayudarle por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Maria is married, has two children, and lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house where she resides in exchange for a loan to the owner (the money is to be returned to Maria at the contract's end). At least the home has all basic services. 

Maria makes and sells fried potatoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase potatoes at wholesale to process. Maria's husband is a careful taxi driver but his earnings are insufficient to cover the family's cost of living and for that reason, she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale to process.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Hoy Mario ya tiene 58 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda de su pareja, la Sra. Amelia, están creciendo. El tiene su despensa en la que esta trabajando arduamente para poder mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida. Este es su tercer préstamo con kiva, lo cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder surtir su negocio, este nuevo préstamo lo pide para poder comprar una camioneta, que le servirá en el transporte de productos para su despensa. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será nuevamente de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mario is 58 years old and very hard-working. Thanks to his work and the help of his wife - Amelia - Mario is growing as a person. He has a shop where he works in order to improve his living conditions. This is Mario's third Kiva loan; the first two were of great help to him.

Mario used his previous loan to stock up his business. He is applying for this loan in order to buy a truck to transport goods for his shop. Mario is grateful for this opportunity that, again, will be of much use to him.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables to expand her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with 1 child. 

She describes herself as full of potential. She operates a retail business where she sells soap and also clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  Her biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soap and clothes. 

Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of soap and clothes

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 34 years old.  She is married with one child who is three years old. Her husband is a businessman.

Louise has been selling clothes for the past 11 months. 

With the loan she would like to buy shirts, pants, and skirts to sell. 

She wishes to become a wholesaler of clothes. The profits from the business will be used to save and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong would like to take an additional loan to buy beverages to sell from her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 58, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband, who works as a turner. 

Phan earns money through her shop selling coffee. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of coffee and beverages to meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy coffee and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba would like to take a further loan to buy more beverages and furniture for her cafe. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages and furniture for her cafe.

loans.name: Trieu

texts.en:
Trieu would like to take a further loan to buy fertilizer to sell from his shop. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to sell at his business.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es: Víctor, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en  unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside actualmente con su esposa e hijos, en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años, este cultivo lo tiene en un terreno cerca a su comunidad y ofrece la producción de frijoles y maíz. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura pero ahora es propio. Ha solicitado un  préstamo  de 6,000 lempiras para la compra de abonos de carga y crecimiento y fumigación para darle mantenimiento  a sus cultivos. Su plan es sembrar más maíz y frijol,  así mismo darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Victor is 29 years old. He is married and has three children. The family lives together in a village in the Quimistán municipality of Santa Bárbara. Victor has been a farmer for four years. He grows crops on land near his community, and sells his corn and beans. Victor has always worked in agriculture but now he works independently. Victor is applying for a loan of 6000 Lempira in order to buy manure and fumigation chemicals to look after his crops. He plans to plant more corn and beans. Victor then wants to improve his children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fumigation chemicals for corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be self committed. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира является растениеводом, проживающим в районе Шахритус. Она в свои 28 лет уже родила и воспитывает троих детей. Ее детям по 2, 4 и 5 лет. Муж Муниры дехканин. На протяжении 6 лет Мунира вместе с мужем занимается сельским хозяйством. Они выращивают огородные и зерновые культуры. Уже начался очередной сезон посева и Мунира готовится к посевным работам. Она провела уже вспашку земли, и сейчас у нее нет сбережений, чтобы купить семена и посадить урожай. Мунира всецело надеется на кредит, благодаря которому она сможет продолжить деятельность.
texts.en: Munira is an agriculturalist, living in the Shahrituz district. At her age of 28, she already gave birth and is raising three children. Her children are 2, 4 and 5 years old. Munira's husband is a dekhan farmer. Munira and her husband have been involved in agriculture for 6 years. They grow garden and cereal crops. The next sowing season has already started, and Munira is preparing to plant crops. She already plowed the soil and now does not have enough savings to purchase seeds and plant them. Munira wholeheartedly hopes for the loan, thanks to which she would be able to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the next sowing

loans.name: Benkasigui  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe BENKASIGUI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOURA-PEULH, un des villages de la commune de TORAKOLOBA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec  SAHALI , 1ère femme assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir :1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  TORAKOLOBA , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 24 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Benkasigui 2 group are married women averaging 39 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in Toura-Peulh, a village in the township of Torakoloba, the district of San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season.

They are on their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow peanuts, which is what Sahali does, for example. She is the first one seated on the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers], seeds, small tools and pay the cost of labor to work one ha [2.5 acre] of land.

After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village and in Torakoloba, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 24,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for cost of labor, agricultural inputs, tools and seeds.

loans.name: Benkasigui  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKASIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOURA-PEULH, un des villages de la commune de TORAKOLOBA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec GNIFLA, 1ère femme debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir :0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  TORAKOLOBA , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 12 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Benkasigui 1 Group are married women with an average age of 46 and an average of six children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in Toura Peulh, one of the villages found in the commune of Torakoloba in San Cercle, the fourth administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were all paid back in full. Gnifla, the woman standing to the far-right in the back row of the photo, grows peanuts. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs, seeds and farming equipment, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Torakoloba to a customer base made up of both men and women. She is planning on making an average profit of 12,000 FCFA by the end of the harvest season, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs, farming equipment and seeds

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is requesting a new loan to buy clothes and shoes for selling from her shop. Mai's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Чумагул жительница района А. Чоми. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. Чумагул является матерью пятерых детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Чумагул занимается разведением овец, коз и крупнорогатого скота. Еще у нее небольшой участок земли, где она занимается растениеводством. Именно эта земля помогает им, они не покупают овощи и фрукты. За счет купле - продажи скота Чумагул покупает детям школьные принадлежности и одежду. Она дорожит каждым заработанным центом. 
Чумагул берет кредит для закупа скота. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, чтобы продолжить свое дело. Так как сейчас ей очень тяжело, дети растут, а муж не может полностью обеспечить семью. Чумагул собирается расширить свое дело и копить деньги на свадьбу, на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a resident of the A. Jomi district. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of five children. Her husband works abroad. Jumagul is involved in raising sheep, goats and cattle. She also has a small plot of land, where she is involved in gardening. Precisely this land helps them because they don't have to buy vegetables and fruits. Reselling livestock allows Jumagul to purchase school supplies and clothing for her children. She values every earned penny. 

Jumagul is requesting this loan to buy livestock. She intends to increase her livestock headcount in order to continue her business. Because it is very difficult for her now with children growing up and the husband not able to fully provide for the family, Jumagul plans to expand her business and save money for a wedding and future education for her children.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to continue her business and save money for a wedding and future education for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan would like to take a further loan to buy a sewing machine and materials to make and sell clothes from her shop. Nhan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials to make and sell clothes.

loans.name: Henry Daniel

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a su gran capacidad de trabajo y tenacidad.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende productos accesorios para celulares, reproductores de sonido, programas informáticos, etc. 

Inicio el negocio hace 1 año y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

Vive en el municipio de Sabaneta, Antioquia y tiene 19 años.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su pequeño negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido en accesorios para celulares y la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de una mejor manera, logrando así atraer más clientes y obtener los recursos necesarios para sostener su hogar junto a su padres. 

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Henry is a man with the smarts to face the world and have a full life thanks to his capacity to work and his determination. He has a store where he sells accessories for cellphones, sound reproduction, software, etc. He started the business one year ago and in spite of the little time in business it has been well received in the market.

He lives in the municipality of Sabaneta, Antioquia and is 19 years old. He wants to expand his offering of products and improve his sales injecting capital into his small business. This is the reason he is requesting a loan to have the opportunity to be independent and have sufficient reason to dedicate himself full-time to his business.

The money will be invested in the purchase of an assortment of accessories for cellphones and to buy a display case to better exhibit his product. He wants to attract more clients and generate the resources needed to support his household along with his parents.

He has high hopes for his business and thinks that it can improve a lot in the future thanks to the institutions that make it possible for people to dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy a display case and stock accessories for cellphones.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take a further loan to buy pork and ingredients to sell from her stall. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pork and food ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 27 years old. She is married with two children; both of them go to school. Her husband is a businessman.  She sells wood and timber, and has been in a business for the past 10 years. 

With the loan, Diane would like to buy windows, doors, and metal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her sales and for savings.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors, and metal.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh would like to take a further loan to buy better quality beef to sell from his shop. 

His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality beef to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi would like to take a further loan to buy more clothes to sell from her shop. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist
her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc would like to take another loan to buy materials to make shoes and slippers to sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality materials to use in making shoes and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Абдурасул трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 31 года. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Абдурасул живёт в сельской местности, в небольшом посёлке. Оночень любит свою жену и детей и старается делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать их всем необходимым.
  
Абдурасул вот уже  около четырёх лет работает водителем микроавтобуса. Это является его бизнесом, который приносит ему хороший стабильный доход. Для этого он имеет собственный микроавтобус. Он перевозит людей из разных близлежащих посёлков их местности. Также он имеет дополнительный доход от другого вида бизнеса. Он откармливает мелко рогатый скот. От этого дела он получает также хороший доход. Сейчас Абдурасул хочет сделать капитальный ремонт своего микроавтобуса, чтобы и дальше использовать его для реализации своего бизнеса. Но у него накопилось недостаточно денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку запчастей для микроавтобуса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.


г
texts.en:
Abdurasul is a hardworking and happy 31-year-old man. He is married and has four children. Abdurasul and his family live in a rural area, in a small village. He loves his wife and children very much and tries to do everything possible to provide them with all of the necessities.

Abdurasul has been working as a van driver for about four years. This is his business that yields him a good and stable income. He owns the van that he uses for the business. He transports people from various nearby villages in his area. He also has an additional income from another type of business. He fattens up small livestock. He also earns a good income from this business. Now Abdurasul wants to make major repairs of his van in order to continue using it for this business, but he has not been able to save enough money. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy spare parts for his van. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his van

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 41-year-old married woman from the village of Orsantia. She has a son and a daughter, a husband and a mother-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. The family doesn't have any significant source of income, as the only important breadwinner is Tea's son, who works at the block workshop. Tea is employed at a local school buffet, and generates 150-200 GEL. She has great desire to start her own business and requested a loan. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Tea applied for the credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

So, Tea was approved for the loan of 4,000 GEL for opening a place to buy nuts receive and resell them locally. She will purchase a stock of nuts and will sell them at wholesale at the local market for increased prices. 

The start up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a place to buy nuts and resell them locally

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Sumina is 30 years old. She is married with three children; two of them go to school. Her husband is a driver, and she sells foodstuffs. She has been working for two years.  

With the loan, she would like to buy bananas, beans, Irish potatoes and charcoal to sell. With the profits, she would like to expand her business to the extent of 90% in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beans, Irish potatoes and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anorgul

texts.ru: Аноргул несмотря на свой пожилой возраст (ей 57 лет) начинает новый бизнес в области продаж. Она составила свой бизнес-план, арендовала на долгосрочной основе новое помещение под магазин в центре своего района Хуросон. Аноргул будет заниматься продажей отделочных материалов, таких как обои, краски, сухие смеси, шпаклевки, щетки и т.д. В ведении нового бизнеса ей будет помогать сын-предприниматель. Чтобы закупить товар и начать торговлю, Аноргул не хватает начального капитала. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом в размере 2000 долларов США. Она надеется, что кредиторы Kiva поддержат ее и дадут ей шанс реализовать себя на рынке продаж.
texts.en: In spite of Anorgul's age (she is 57), she is starting a new retail business. She developed her business plan and rented the premises for a shop in the center of the Khuroson district. Anorgul will sell home improvement supplies such as wallpaper, paint, dry mixes, putty, brushes, and so forth. Her son is an entrepreneur and will help her run the new business. She does not have the capital to purchase inventory and open the store, so she applied for a loan of $2000 (USD). She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her and give her the chance to establish herself in the retail market.

loans.use: to purchase home improvement supplies to start a new business

loans.name: Mirna Teresa

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una institución tan prestigiada como lo es ADICLA.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 23 años soltera con tanta dedicación ella se esmera en lo que realiza cada día con una visión amplia hacia el futuro.

La actividad que ella realiza es contadora en ADICLA, ella lleva trabajando para la institución 5 años lo cual ha sido satisfactoria para ella y para su familia porque por medio de su trabajo ella a logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la le ella.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al préstamo es para la compra de una computadora para la realización de su trabajo con eficacia y exactitud en la institución. Las metas de ella es ampliar más sus conocimientos para la buena realización de sus actividades cotidianas.
texts.en:
Life gave Mirna Teresa the opportunity to work as an employee for a prestigious institution, ADICLA.  It was what she hoped for.  It was not just an open door, but it was also what was behind this door.  What she found was something that defined what she wanted to be.  She is 23 years old and single.  She very conscientiously puts great effort into what she does every day, and she does it with a big vision towards the future.

She is a bookkeeper for ADICLA.  She has been working for the institution for five years.  This has been good for her and her family because, through her work, she has managed to improve the living conditions for herself and for her family.

She will use the loan to buy a computer to do her work in the institution efficiently and precisely.  Her goal is to expand her knowledge in order to do good daily work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take another loan to buy a larger stock of materials to increase her flower production to sell from her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of material to increase her flower production to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to buy materials to make slippers. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of material to make slippers.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
El joven José Leonel habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio y brindan su servicio a la población para sobre vivir.   

José Leonel se Llama el Joven de 45 Años de edad con tres hijito bajo su cargo, con lo poco que el gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus hijos y le brinda una buena educación, pero es de su gran necesidad construir una pequeña cocina donde pueda elaborar sus alimentos ya que su viviendita es pequeña y no tiene este tipo de condiciones.

Desde hace once años ejerce el trabajo como colector de impuesto en una de las alcaldías del estado. 

Desde hace 5 años ha sido de sus sueños tener una cocina en su vivienda, pero no la había podido logra.

Hoy en día se dio Cuenta que Ceprodel y Kiva también apoyaba para este tipo de mejora, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitar un pequeño préstamo para la compra de: zinc, cemento, arena y ladrillo, esto le ayudaría mucho a construir este anexo que son de sus sueños.

Comenta que con Ceprodel y Kiva se le cumplirán sus sueños no solo a él si no también a muchas personas con esta misma necesidad de vida.      

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado por todo este tiempo y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos.
texts.en:
José Leonel lives in the Achuapa municipality in the León department.  It is a city where the people engage in diverse commercial activities and provide services in order to survive. José Leonel is 45 years old and has 3 children in his care.  With the little that he earns, he struggles to help with the daily sustenance of his children and with giving them a good education.

He greatly needs to build a small kitchen where food could be made.  His house is small, and they do not have a kitchen.

Eleven years ago, he worked as a tax collector for a state government institution.  He has had the dream of building a kitchen in his house for five years, but he has not been able to do it.

He now realizes that CEPRODEL and Kiva also support this type of improvement.  Therefore, he decided to request a small loan in order to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand, and bricks.  This will really help him to build this addition to the house, which is his dream.  He says that with CEPRODEL and Kiva his dream will be fulfilled.  This is true not just for him but also for a lot of people with this type of need.

He is grateful for the support that CEPRODEL and Kiva have given him during all of this time.  He hopes to God to continue receiving the privilege of these small loans.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Felistas

texts.en:
Felistas is a 42-year-old woman married to Onesmus who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with five children. Felistas has been operating a livestock business for a period of nine years, earning an income of KES. 8,000 at the end of every month.

Felistas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is servicing her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use this amount to buy cows, goats, and hens for rearing.

Felistas plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To  buy cows, goats, and hens for rearing

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 42 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom go to school. Her husband is a nurse. She has been running her shop for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy bananas, beans, Irish potatoes, sorghum and charcoal for resale. The resulting profits will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, Irish potatoes, sorghum and chacoal for resale.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a transport business using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge as the fluctuation of fuel prices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a matatu (mini-bus) within five years.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a married father of two, was born in 1985, and has a secondary level of education. While attending school, he was helping his dad in glass decoration. He then quit school and continued working in this field to help his father cover their family’s expenses and living needs.
 
Today, Alaa has twenty years of experience in glass decoration, and yet he doesn’t own a shop. He has a mobile business where he provides his services in various villages and regions and works hard on spreading his work and reputation everywhere.

Alaa is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to expand his work by buying new, updated equipment for his business, as he hopes to open his own shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy new, updated equipment for his work, as he hopes to open his own shop in the future.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 24-year-old single man from a village near the city of Nablus. He owns and operates an auto repair workshop. It has been open for the past three years. Eyad is now experienced in this field. He would like to improve his business, and maybe he will expand his workshop in the future. Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more repair parts for his auto repair workshop. By taking out this loan, Eyad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. Eyad appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own computer shop for seven years, and she earns a good living from this activity. She has increased responsibilities, which requires more effort to provide for the family’s needs, especially for her child. She has had to work hard, determined to better her income and provide her child with a better education. To improve her service and profits, Paulina decided to apply for a new loan. With this PHP 30,000, she can pre-buy supplies and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. She sincerely gives you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation in advance for this assistance. In the future, Paulina hopes that her business will continue to cover the needs of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is a 63-year-old single woman who lives alone in Terjola district. She can make ends meet only with monthly assistance from local government. Sadly, because of a lack of economic resources, Makvala was unable to follow a professional career, and she can't find a stable job. Her income is barely enough for her to confront her financial difficulties. Accordingly, Makvala decided to become involved in her own trading business. She needs financial support to purchase a stock of clothing and begin trading locally. She applied for a loan from local financial institutions several times to start up her trading business, but without any success. Her loan application was rejected every time, because the lenders did not find the existing family income sufficient to justify approving the loan. Makvala applied for a loan from Credo and was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup credit on soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. The loan will be great support for Makvala, enabling her to generate her own income and build a  better style of life.

loans.use: to start her own clothing trading business.

loans.name: Elmije

texts.en:
Elmije is an Ashkali woman who is 44 years old with a son and daughter. Her husband is not able to work because he is too ill to be able to maintain a stable job. Their son and Elmije would like to start a business cutting wood to sell for heating in the winter. They already have a wood-cutting machine, but they are in need of a loan in order to purchase some additional tools to help with their work. 

Elmije hopes that they will be able to find customers and a space in the market for them to sell the wood and that will help the family to be able to live and pay for the medical care her husband needs. Her overall goal is to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase some additional tools for her wood-cutting business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

Samson states that his biggest business challenge is fuel prices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a matatu (minibus) within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Felismina  39 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è empacotadora de banana na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 6 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area, varroes  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Tem com   grande desafio melhor as condições de habitação e a dieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felismina is 39 years old and the single mother of 4 children who are going to primary and secondary school. She has been a packer at the banana production company for more than 6 years.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, sand, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction work on her house.

Her biggest challenge is to improve her family's living conditions and diet.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, sand, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction work on her house.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda is 31 years old. She is widowed and lives with her two children in a rural area. Mahsuda is an industrious woman, and she works hard to earn a living. She has been busy with animal husbandry for some years. She has great experience in this way. 

She feeds sheep as well as cows. Mahsuda has a big cowshed in her house. She grows cattle feed in her garden. Mahsuda’s brother helps her with feeding and selling the cattle. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Jargalsaikhan, 58 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been running a fast food restaurant together with her friend since 2013. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their son recently graduated from his university and now is looking for a job. 

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant. The main family income comes from this business and it is important to update any equipment in her restaurant for better service.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant
